Element.Translation: Although unarmored and with average health, factories can quickly and easily create Basic Armor by processing a small amount of basic materials.
Element.Original: Although unarmored and with average health, factories can quickly and easily create Basic Armor by processing a small amount of basic materials.

Element.Translation:
Provides basic power regeneration that many other systems rely on. 
Requires Stabilizers to function properly.

If your Stabilization is too low, you will have reduced power generation.
The Reactor and its Chambers are also highly reactive unless you have 100% or more Stabilization.
Upon taking damage, your Reactor components will take additional damage from internal explosions.

It's advised to have more than 100% Stabilization to avoid taking extra damage when in combat.
Element.Original:
Provides basic power regeneration that many other systems rely on. 
Requires Stabilizers to function properly.

If your Stabilization is too low, you will have reduced power generation.
The Reactor and its Chambers are also highly reactive unless you have 100% or more Stabilization.
Upon taking damage, your Reactor components will take additional damage from internal explosions.

It's advised to have more than 100% Stabilization to avoid taking extra damage when in combat.

Element.Translation:
Increases the Stabilization rating of your active Reactor. This block loses efficiency the closer it gets to the Active reactor.
Each Reactor size (level) has an optimal distance where the efficiency of your stabilization reaches a maximum value.

If your Stabilization is too low, you will have reduced power generation.
The Reactor and its Chambers are also highly reactive unless you have 100% or more Stabilization.
Upon taking damage, your Reactor components will take additional damage from internal explosions.

It's advised to have more than 100% Stabilization to avoid taking extra damage when in combat.
Element.Original:
Increases the Stabilization rating of your active Reactor. This block loses efficiency the closer it gets to the Active reactor.
Each Reactor size (level) has an optimal distance where the efficiency of your stabilization reaches a maximum value.

If your Stabilization is too low, you will have reduced power generation.
The Reactor and its Chambers are also highly reactive unless you have 100% or more Stabilization.
Upon taking damage, your Reactor components will take additional damage from internal explosions.

It's advised to have more than 100% Stabilization to avoid taking extra damage when in combat.

Element.Translation: A conduit to connect a group of Reactor Power blocks to a Chamber.\n\r\n\rIt automatically connects chambers <-> chambers or chamber <-> reactor, when the touching conduit blocks are in physical contact with both groups.
Element.Original: A conduit to connect a group of Reactor Power blocks to a Chamber.\n\r\n\rIt automatically connects chambers <-> chambers or chamber <-> reactor, when the touching conduit blocks are in physical contact with both groups.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance mobility.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance mobility.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance recon capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance recon capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance FTL capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance FTL capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance stealth capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance stealth capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance logistics.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance logistics.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Enables Stealth Drive. While active, protects your structure from being scanned in addition to providing extra stealth mechanics through other chamber effects.\n\rYour stealth strength decides how well your structure information and stealth drive functionality is protected against scans.
Element.Original: Enables Stealth Drive. While active, protects your structure from being scanned in addition to providing extra stealth mechanics through other chamber effects.\n\rYour stealth strength decides how well your structure information and stealth drive functionality is protected against scans.

Element.Translation: A carnivorous plant that lures it's prey with a sticky bioluminescent orb.
Element.Original: A carnivorous plant that lures it's prey with a sticky bioluminescent orb.

Element.Translation: Enables the Reactor Booster. This increases your power recharge for a short duration while active. \n\rRequires to be charged prior to activation.\n\r
Element.Original: Enables the Reactor Booster. This increases your power recharge for a short duration while active. \n\rRequires to be charged prior to activation.\n\r

Element.Translation: Enables anti lockon while the Stealth Drive is active, stopping any missile weapon from locking on to you.\n\r
Element.Original: Enables anti lockon while the Stealth Drive is active, stopping any missile weapon from locking on to you.\n\r

Element.Translation: Enables a failsafe measure to automatically switch over to the 2nd biggest reactor if the current one is about to fail.
Element.Original: Enables a failsafe measure to automatically switch over to the 2nd biggest reactor if the current one is about to fail.

Element.Translation: Reactor Shield Power Efficiency 1 NOT AVAILABLE
Element.Original: Reactor Shield Power Efficiency 1 NOT AVAILABLE

Element.Translation: A small berry bush. Commonly found on temperate planets.
Element.Original: A small berry bush. Commonly found on temperate planets.

Element.Translation: Enables permanent usage of your Stealth Drive at the cost of always consuming power.
Element.Original: Enables permanent usage of your Stealth Drive at the cost of always consuming power.

Element.Translation: Increases the usage duration of your Stealth Drive.
Element.Original: Increases the usage duration of your Stealth Drive.

Element.Translation:
Changes your shield density to take less damage from high damage weapons.
This makes the shield more vulnerable to low damage weapons though.

Efficient against slow firing weapons.
Element.Original:
Changes your shield density to take less damage from high damage weapons.
This makes the shield more vulnerable to low damage weapons though.

Efficient against slow firing weapons.

Element.Translation: Enables Personal Gravity, providing a radial gravity field the size of your structure.
Element.Original: Enables Personal Gravity, providing a radial gravity field the size of your structure.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance defensive capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance defensive capabilities.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Enables radarjammer while the Stealth Drive is active, only hiding your navigation marker/radar signature.\n\r
Element.Original: Enables radarjammer while the Stealth Drive is active, only hiding your navigation marker/radar signature.\n\r

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enhance power.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enhance power.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Increases the capacity of all shields.
Element.Original: Increases the capacity of all shields.

Element.Translation: Basic enhancement for all your Shields.
Element.Original: Basic enhancement for all your Shields.

Element.Translation: Long Range Scanners Base NOT AVAILABLE
Element.Original: Long Range Scanners Base NOT AVAILABLE

Element.Translation: Enables Long Range Scanner. Provides extra information of your current system and region, not yet usable (universe update).
Element.Original: Enables Long Range Scanner. Provides extra information of your current system and region, not yet usable (universe update).

Element.Translation: A ship module to give you a powerful push into any direction that you're thrusting to.\n\rIts strength depends on your thrust to mass ratio.\n\rIts power consumption depends on how much thrust you have.
Element.Original: A ship module to give you a powerful push into any direction that you're thrusting to.\n\rIts strength depends on your thrust to mass ratio.\n\rIts power consumption depends on how much thrust you have.

Element.Translation: Enables the ability to store multiple charges of your Thrust Blast.
Element.Original: Enables the ability to store multiple charges of your Thrust Blast.

Element.Translation: Increases the ore/shard resource yield for each resouce block mined.
Element.Original: Increases the ore/shard resource yield for each resouce block mined.

Element.Translation: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any heat based damage.
Element.Original: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any heat based damage.

Element.Translation: Increases the system range of your Long Range Scanner.
Element.Original: Increases the system range of your Long Range Scanner.

Element.Translation: Decreases the time it takes since the last hit for shields to regenerate.
Element.Original: Decreases the time it takes since the last hit for shields to regenerate.

Element.Translation: Reactor Shield Power Efficiency 2 NOT AVAILABLE
Element.Original: Reactor Shield Power Efficiency 2 NOT AVAILABLE

Element.Translation: Increases the volume capacity usage of your factories and storage blocks.
Element.Original: Increases the volume capacity usage of your factories and storage blocks.

Element.Translation: Decreases the time needed to produce a block.
Element.Original: Decreases the time needed to produce a block.

Element.Translation: Increases the top speed of your ship.
Element.Original: Increases the top speed of your ship.

Element.Translation: A carnivorous plant that lures it's prey with bioluminescent tendrils.
Element.Original: A carnivorous plant that lures it's prey with bioluminescent tendrils.

Element.Translation: Decreases the power usage of your Jump Drive.
Element.Original: Decreases the power usage of your Jump Drive.

Element.Translation: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any eletctromagnetic based damage.
Element.Original: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any eletctromagnetic based damage.

Element.Translation:
Enables the Jump Inhibitor.

When enabled, it prevents any ship with a reactor level equal or less than the inhibitor's strength, to not function..
Power consumption depends on the target reactor level regeneration.
Element.Original:
Enables the Jump Inhibitor.

When enabled, it prevents any ship with a reactor level equal or less than the inhibitor's strength, to not function..
Power consumption depends on the target reactor level regeneration.

Element.Translation: Increases the strength of your Scanner.
Element.Original: Increases the strength of your Scanner.

Element.Translation: Enables cloaking while the Stealth Drive is active, visually hiding your structure.\n\rThe Stealth Drive's cloaking ability is countered by a strong enough scanner, it will be completely shut down.
Element.Original: Enables cloaking while the Stealth Drive is active, visually hiding your structure.\n\rThe Stealth Drive's cloaking ability is countered by a strong enough scanner, it will be completely shut down.

Element.Translation: Enables Personal Gravity, providing a linear gravity field the size of your structure.
Element.Original: Enables Personal Gravity, providing a linear gravity field the size of your structure.

Element.Translation:
Enables the free target mode for all warpgates on this structure. 
No target warpgate is required as you can now freely set any destination sector within range.

Press %ACTIVATE on a Warpgate Computer to set a target sector.
Element.Original:
Enables the free target mode for all warpgates on this structure. 
No target warpgate is required as you can now freely set any destination sector within range.

Press %ACTIVATE on a Warpgate Computer to set a target sector.

Element.Translation: This is the load rail module. Docking to a block like this will push items from the connected chests of this rail block to the chests that are connected to the rail docker of the docked ship. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.
Element.Original: This is the load rail module. Docking to a block like this will push items from the connected chests of this rail block to the chests that are connected to the rail docker of the docked ship. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.

Element.Translation: This is the unload rail module. Docking to a block like this will pull items from the chests that are connected to the rail docker of the docked ship to the chests that are connected to this rail block. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.
Element.Original: This is the unload rail module. Docking to a block like this will pull items from the chests that are connected to the rail docker of the docked ship to the chests that are connected to this rail block. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.

Element.Translation: Reduces the effect of gravity wells on your ship.
Element.Original: Reduces the effect of gravity wells on your ship.

Element.Translation: Decreases the power usage of your factories.
Element.Original: Decreases the power usage of your factories.

Element.Translation: Speeds up how long it takes to apply a change to your thrust configuration.
Element.Original: Speeds up how long it takes to apply a change to your thrust configuration.

Element.Translation: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any kinetic based damage.
Element.Original: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any kinetic based damage.

Element.Translation: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any environmental based damage.
Element.Original: Increases the amount of damage your armor blocks can withstand from any environmental based damage.

Element.Translation: Enables the ability to automatically charge your Jump Drive.\n\r
Element.Original: Enables the ability to automatically charge your Jump Drive.\n\r

Element.Translation: Basic enhancement for your Armor blocks.
Element.Original: Basic enhancement for your Armor blocks.

Element.Translation:
Changes your shield density to take less damage from low damage weapons.
This makes the shield more vulnerable to high damage weapons though.

Efficient against fast firing weapons.
Element.Original:
Changes your shield density to take less damage from low damage weapons.
This makes the shield more vulnerable to high damage weapons though.

Efficient against fast firing weapons.

Element.Translation: Increases the turn rate of your ship.
Element.Original: Increases the turn rate of your ship.

Element.Translation: Uses a part of your Thrust (set in the the Thrust Configuration menu) to apply a force in the orientation of this block.\n\rWorks only within proximity of another block and gravity well.
Element.Original: Uses a part of your Thrust (set in the the Thrust Configuration menu) to apply a force in the orientation of this block.\n\rWorks only within proximity of another block and gravity well.

Element.Translation: This was an old version of the docks, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways??
Element.Original: This was an old version of the docks, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways??

Element.Translation: The Plex Lift can be used to create elevators and lifts within large stations or ships where needed. They are especially useful when combined with the Gravity Unit. Similar to Plex Doors, having them adjacent on one another allows for larger/longer lifts. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate.
Element.Original: The Plex Lift can be used to create elevators and lifts within large stations or ships where needed. They are especially useful when combined with the Gravity Unit. Similar to Plex Doors, having them adjacent on one another allows for larger/longer lifts. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate.

Element.Translation: This was an old version of the factories, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways?
Element.Original: This was an old version of the factories, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways?

Element.Translation: Increases the jump distance of your Warpgates.
Element.Original: Increases the jump distance of your Warpgates.

Element.Translation: Increases the jump distance of your Jump Drive.
Element.Original: Increases the jump distance of your Jump Drive.

Element.Translation: The Storage block functions like a persistent, dynamic inventory. This enables the user to store items from their inventory in it. You can expand its volume size by linking it to Cargo Space blocks. Press $ACTIVATE to access. Storage blocks can also act as filters, and can be linked to; Salvage systems, Logic blocks and Factories. This makes them quite useful in various automated setups.
Element.Original: The Storage block functions like a persistent, dynamic inventory. This enables the user to store items from their inventory in it. You can expand its volume size by linking it to Cargo Space blocks. Press $ACTIVATE to access. Storage blocks can also act as filters, and can be linked to; Salvage systems, Logic blocks and Factories. This makes them quite useful in various automated setups.

Element.Translation: The BOBBY AI Module is a capable of providing basic and rudimentary automation and functions. Useful for building automated turrets, amongst a few other applications. It can be configured by opening up your Menu (Inventory, Weapons, Shop,Navigation), and looking for the AI Config button on the bottom right. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate.
Element.Original: The BOBBY AI Module is a capable of providing basic and rudimentary automation and functions. Useful for building automated turrets, amongst a few other applications. It can be configured by opening up your Menu (Inventory, Weapons, Shop,Navigation), and looking for the AI Config button on the bottom right. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate.

Element.Translation: These modules can be used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.
Element.Original: These modules can be used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.

Element.Translation: The Build Block can be placed almost anywhere, and allows the user to enter Build Mode without the need of a Ship Core. Enabling Structures other than ships to be built. Press $ACTIVATE to Enter/Exit.
Element.Original: The Build Block can be placed almost anywhere, and allows the user to enter Build Mode without the need of a Ship Core. Enabling Structures other than ships to be built. Press $ACTIVATE to Enter/Exit.

Element.Translation:
Basic enhancement for the Short Range Scanner. When the Scanner is active, it provides extra information of all nearby entities.
Your scanner strength versus the stealth strength of your target, decides how much information you receive and what it counters of a Stealth Drive.

- Disables cloak
- Disables jamming
- Weapon group information
- Chamber group information
- Reactor group information

If enabled on the server, this chamber will also enable the Short Range Scanner on your structure. 
Otherwise it's already available.
Element.Original:
Basic enhancement for the Short Range Scanner. When the Scanner is active, it provides extra information of all nearby entities.
Your scanner strength versus the stealth strength of your target, decides how much information you receive and what it counters of a Stealth Drive.

- Disables cloak
- Disables jamming
- Weapon group information
- Chamber group information
- Reactor group information

If enabled on the server, this chamber will also enable the Short Range Scanner on your structure. 
Otherwise it's already available.

Element.Translation: Increases the recharge speed of your Jump Drive.
Element.Original: Increases the recharge speed of your Jump Drive.

Element.Translation: The Warhead is a simple, but effective explosive. It can be grouped with other warheads to increase the explosion created. They may be activated by collisions, triggered by logic systems, manual triggering (risky stuff), or simply shot. The can be used for ramming, self destruct systems, breaching charges, traps, demolition and more. Press $ACTIVATE to detonate
Element.Original: The Warhead is a simple, but effective explosive. It can be grouped with other warheads to increase the explosion created. They may be activated by collisions, triggered by logic systems, manual triggering (risky stuff), or simply shot. The can be used for ramming, self destruct systems, breaching charges, traps, demolition and more. Press $ACTIVATE to detonate

Element.Translation: The Cannon Barrel, when used in conjunction with a Cannon Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Cannon fires a simple projectile in a straight line. Cannons do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the projectile by finding the Cannon Barrel you want to output the shot, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Cannon Barrel, when used in conjunction with a Cannon Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Cannon fires a simple projectile in a straight line. Cannons do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the projectile by finding the Cannon Barrel you want to output the shot, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: Each Ship Core functions as the cornerstone of your ship, it also provides a basic amount of thrust, power generation, power capacity, as well as some shield capacity. Remember, always carry spare cores to avoid becoming marooned. Press $SPAWN_SHIP with a Ship Core anywhere in your inventory to place the core in the space in front of you. Press $ACTIVATE to Enter/Exit.
Element.Original: Each Ship Core functions as the cornerstone of your ship, it also provides a basic amount of thrust, power generation, power capacity, as well as some shield capacity. Remember, always carry spare cores to avoid becoming marooned. Press $SPAWN_SHIP with a Ship Core anywhere in your inventory to place the core in the space in front of you. Press $ACTIVATE to Enter/Exit.

Element.Translation: The Salvage Module, when used in conjunction with a Salvage Computer, can create a basic but effective salvage/mining system. The Salvage Module fires a salvage beam in a straight line. Salvage Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their salvage speed. You can also choose which block outputs the beam by finding the Salvage Module you want to output the beam, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it. Salvage Modules can be used to Salvage parts from inactive or defeated Ships and Stations or mine Asteroids and Planets for resources.
Element.Original: The Salvage Module, when used in conjunction with a Salvage Computer, can create a basic but effective salvage/mining system. The Salvage Module fires a salvage beam in a straight line. Salvage Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their salvage speed. You can also choose which block outputs the beam by finding the Salvage Module you want to output the beam, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it. Salvage Modules can be used to Salvage parts from inactive or defeated Ships and Stations or mine Asteroids and Planets for resources.

Element.Translation: Leaves commonly found on Redwood Trees.
Element.Original: Leaves commonly found on Redwood Trees.

Element.Translation: The Docking Module allows the user to create a fixed Docking Zone. This Zone can then be Docked/Undocked with, by using the Ship Core's built-in Docking Beam. Docking Modules can be oriented, and must not have any obstructions in their Zone (The Green Box), other than the docked item in question. Otherwise, the Module will go offline, and no docking will be allowed until the obstruction is removed.
Element.Original: The Docking Module allows the user to create a fixed Docking Zone. This Zone can then be Docked/Undocked with, by using the Ship Core's built-in Docking Beam. Docking Modules can be oriented, and must not have any obstructions in their Zone (The Green Box), other than the docked item in question. Otherwise, the Module will go offline, and no docking will be allowed until the obstruction is removed.

Element.Translation: The Docking Enhancer can be used to increase the size of the Docking Zone created by a Docking Module. To use them, simply connect them to the Docking Module whose zone you want to increase by selecting the Module with C, and then using V to connect each Enhancer. As with Weapons, and other blocks that can be connected. The Docking Enhancers do not have to be adjacent to the Docking Module. Alternatively, you can lay a Docking Module down, select it with C, and then each Docking Enhancer you put down afterwards will be automatically connected to the Docking Module. As of now, there is no need to orient Docking Enhancers, as they will increase the Docking Zone all around, no matter which way they are facing, or where they are put in correlation to the Docking Module.
Element.Original: The Docking Enhancer can be used to increase the size of the Docking Zone created by a Docking Module. To use them, simply connect them to the Docking Module whose zone you want to increase by selecting the Module with C, and then using V to connect each Enhancer. As with Weapons, and other blocks that can be connected. The Docking Enhancers do not have to be adjacent to the Docking Module. Alternatively, you can lay a Docking Module down, select it with C, and then each Docking Enhancer you put down afterwards will be automatically connected to the Docking Module. As of now, there is no need to orient Docking Enhancers, as they will increase the Docking Zone all around, no matter which way they are facing, or where they are put in correlation to the Docking Module.

Element.Translation: The Faction Module can be used to claim ownership of ships, stations, asteroids, and planets. It is fairly durable, but it isn't impervious. So protecting it is of the utmost importance. Ships fitted with an active Faction Module cannot be destroyed while docked at their factions home base. Only one Faction Module can be placed per structure. The Faction Module allows use of several features to its user. These features include: -Password protection -Permissions: Single-user/Faction/All Press $ACTIVATE on it to access them.
Element.Original: The Faction Module can be used to claim ownership of ships, stations, asteroids, and planets. It is fairly durable, but it isn't impervious. So protecting it is of the utmost importance. Ships fitted with an active Faction Module cannot be destroyed while docked at their factions home base. Only one Faction Module can be placed per structure. The Faction Module allows use of several features to its user. These features include: -Password protection -Permissions: Single-user/Faction/All Press $ACTIVATE on it to access them.

Element.Translation: This module contains an interface for factions. Users can look up lists, join recruiting factions, and see the overall relationshp of factions to each other. A permanent faction hub can be found on every shop.
Element.Original: This module contains an interface for factions. Users can look up lists, join recruiting factions, and see the overall relationshp of factions to each other. A permanent faction hub can be found on every shop.

Element.Translation: Power Reactors provide an infinite source of power to supply your Power Capacitors. The rate at which these reactors generate energy is dependant on the specific size and layout of each group of connected modules as well as the total number of modules placed on a ship. Well designed groups of reactors may generate bonus power, although this bonus slowly declines until it reaches 1 Million power generation. Each module also adds a flat 25 power generation per second. This flat rate is always granted independantly of the bonus.
Element.Original: Power Reactors provide an infinite source of power to supply your Power Capacitors. The rate at which these reactors generate energy is dependant on the specific size and layout of each group of connected modules as well as the total number of modules placed on a ship. Well designed groups of reactors may generate bonus power, although this bonus slowly declines until it reaches 1 Million power generation. Each module also adds a flat 25 power generation per second. This flat rate is always granted independantly of the bonus.

Element.Translation: The Repair Beam Module, when used in conjunction with a Repair Beam Computer, can create a basic but effective repair system. The Astrotech Module fires a repair beam in a straight line. Astrotech Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their repair speed. You can also choose which block outputs the beam by finding the Astrotech Module you want to output the beam, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it. AstroTech Modules can used to repair damage to blocks.

Element.Translation: Relatively cheap and easy to make, Glass allows clear exterior views, however it has little in the way of durability when shot.
Element.Original: Relatively cheap and easy to make, Glass allows clear exterior views, however it has little in the way of durability when shot.

Element.Translation: The Missile Tube, when used in conjunction with a Missile Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Missile fires a dumb missile in a straight line. Missiles do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the projectile by finding the Missile Tube you want to output the missile, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Missile Tube, when used in conjunction with a Missile Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Missile fires a dumb missile in a straight line. Missiles do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the projectile by finding the Missile Tube you want to output the missile, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: Relatively cheap and easy to make, Glass allows clear exterior views, however it has little in the way of durability when shot.
Element.Original: Relatively cheap and easy to make, Glass allows clear exterior views, however it has little in the way of durability when shot.

Element.Translation: Power Capacitors are what all ship systems draw their power from. Larger connected groups allow for more power to be stored per block used. If the total power capacity of a structure is less than that of the structures power generation, the excess power is lost. Systems trying to draw more power than is available in the power storage will have difficulty operating as well.
Element.Original: Power Capacitors are what all ship systems draw their power from. Larger connected groups allow for more power to be stored per block used. If the total power capacity of a structure is less than that of the structures power generation, the excess power is lost. Systems trying to draw more power than is available in the power storage will have difficulty operating as well.

Element.Translation: The Power Drain Computer is required for creating functioning Power Drain systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Power Drain Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Power Drain Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Power Drain Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Power Drain Computer is required for creating functioning Power Drain systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Power Drain Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Power Drain Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Power Drain Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Power Drain Module, when used in conjunction with a Power Drain Computer, can create a basic but effective power transfer system. The Power Drain Module fires a transfer beam in a straight line. Power Drain Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their transfer rate. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Power Drain Module you want to output the effect, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Power Drain Module, when used in conjunction with a Power Drain Computer, can create a basic but effective power transfer system. The Power Drain Module fires a transfer beam in a straight line. Power Drain Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their transfer rate. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Power Drain Module you want to output the effect, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: The Power Supply Computer is required for creating functioning Power Supply systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Power Supply Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Power Supply Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Power Supply Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Power Supply Computer is required for creating functioning Power Supply systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Power Supply Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Power Supply Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Power Supply Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Power Supply Module, when used in conjunction with a Power Supply Computer, can create a basic but effective power transfer system. The Power Supply Module fires a transfer beam in a straight line. Power Supply Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their transfer rate. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Power Supply Module you want to output the effect, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: This is a decorative elecrical panel.
Element.Original: This is a decorative elecrical panel.

Element.Translation: This is a decorative server rack.
Element.Original: This is a decorative server rack.

Element.Translation: This is a set of decorative pipes.
Element.Original: This is a set of decorative pipes.

Element.Translation: This is a decorative elecrical panel with screens.
Element.Original: This is a decorative elecrical panel with screens.

Element.Translation: Simple to create, Light Rods are an easy way to add some lighting to the area.
Element.Original: Simple to create, Light Rods are an easy way to add some lighting to the area.

Element.Translation: A special prize item mainly used in player created mini-games.
Element.Original: A special prize item mainly used in player created mini-games.

Element.Translation: A special prize item mainly used in player created mini-games.
Element.Original: A special prize item mainly used in player created mini-games.

Element.Translation: A special prize item mainly used in player created mini-games.

Element.Translation: The Push Pulse Computer is required for creating functioning Push Pulse systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Push Pulse Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Push Pulse Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Push Pulse Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Push Pulse Computer is required for creating functioning Push Pulse systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Push Pulse Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Push Pulse Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Push Pulse Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Push Pulse Module, when used in conjunction with a Push Pulse Computer, can create a basic but effective momentum system. The Push Pulse Module fires a momentum AOE field directly adjacent to the output point. Push Pulse Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their effect. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Push Pulse Module you want to output the pulse, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Push Pulse Module, when used in conjunction with a Push Pulse Computer, can create a basic but effective momentum system. The Push Pulse Module fires a momentum AOE field directly adjacent to the output point. Push Pulse Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their effect. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Push Pulse Module you want to output the pulse, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: Modifies the permissions needed to use blocks normally locked by faction modules. When connected to a module, it shuts off the faction member requirement needed to activate that block.
Element.Original: Modifies the permissions needed to use blocks normally locked by faction modules. When connected to a module, it shuts off the faction member requirement needed to activate that block.

Element.Translation: Used by players to create their own shops that they can stock with blocks and/or items and open to the public or keep restricted to specific faction ranks. The prices of each block may be set here, as well as the quantities desired.
Element.Original: Used by players to create their own shops that they can stock with blocks and/or items and open to the public or keep restricted to specific faction ranks. The prices of each block may be set here, as well as the quantities desired.

Element.Translation: The Tractor Beam Computer is capable of controlling any amount of Tractor Beam Modules. \n\rStrength depends on the amount of linked modules, you can switch firing modes with your Right Click.

Element.Translation: Increases the amount of missiles stored. Requires power to function.

Element.Translation: The Repair Beam Computer is required for creating functioning Repair systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Repair Beam Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Astrotech Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at an Astrotech Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Repair Beam Computer is required for creating functioning Repair systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Repair Beam Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Astrotech Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at an Astrotech Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Shield Capacitor is capable of generating a shield around the object it is attached to. While it is not affected by the tradition(Adjacent) grouping mechanism, they are affected by the non-traditional (Non-adjacent) grouping mechanism. Meaning that two Shield Capacitors next to each other, and two that are apart but attached to the same object, will have the same storage capacity. Shield Capacitors are dependant on Shield-Rechargers to replenish the special energy they use to project their shields.
Element.Original: The Shield Capacitor is capable of generating a shield around the object it is attached to. While it is not affected by the tradition(Adjacent) grouping mechanism, they are affected by the non-traditional (Non-adjacent) grouping mechanism. Meaning that two Shield Capacitors next to each other, and two that are apart but attached to the same object, will have the same storage capacity. Shield Capacitors are dependant on Shield-Rechargers to replenish the special energy they use to project their shields.

Element.Translation: This module can be used to remotely activate any other module that can be activated. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate. You have to select it and connect it to the module (e.g. a door) for it to work. (Default: select with C, look at the door and press V.)
Element.Original: This module can be used to remotely activate any other module that can be activated. Press $ACTIVATE to Activate/Deactivate. You have to select it and connect it to the module (e.g. a door) for it to work. (Default: select with C, look at the door and press V.)

Element.Translation: This is the same as the Delay signal, with the difference that it will not activate again from the same signal in a loop.
Element.Original: This is the same as the Delay signal, with the difference that it will not activate again from the same signal in a loop.

Element.Translation: This module will take the input, wait, and then send it after a delay.
Element.Original: This module will take the input, wait, and then send it after a delay.

Element.Translation: A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output. This module will send "on" only when all logic modules connected to it are "on".
Element.Original: A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output. This module will send "on" only when all logic modules connected to it are "on".

Element.Translation: A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output. This module will send "on" only if at least one logic module connected to it is "on".
Element.Original: A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output. This module will send "on" only if at least one logic module connected to it is "on".

Element.Translation: The Shield Drain Module, when used in conjunction with a Shield Drain Computer, can create a basic but effective shield transfer system. The Shield Drain Module fires a transfer beam in a straight line. Shield Drain Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their transfer rate. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Shield Drain Module you want to output the effect, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Shield Drain Module, when used in conjunction with a Shield Drain Computer, can create a basic but effective shield transfer system. The Shield Drain Module fires a transfer beam in a straight line. Shield Drain Modules do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their transfer rate. You can also choose which block outputs the effect by finding the Shield Drain Module you want to output the effect, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: Will invert the input connected to this module, and delegates it to the modules connected to it. A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output.
Element.Original: Will invert the input connected to this module, and delegates it to the modules connected to it. A logic gate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that is, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces a single logical output.

Element.Translation: This block can only be seen in the structure's build mode. It connects to the Trigger (Area) Controller. Use it to build areas that activate when someone enters it. On activation, only one signal is sent. It will not activate again, until the catalyst leaves the area. It will activate once for each object, should multiple objects enter the area.
Element.Original: This block can only be seen in the structure's build mode. It connects to the Trigger (Area) Controller. Use it to build areas that activate when someone enters it. On activation, only one signal is sent. It will not activate again, until the catalyst leaves the area. It will activate once for each object, should multiple objects enter the area.

Element.Translation: This module can be placed and connected, to a logic structure. The block will activate when a player in gravity steps on it.
Element.Original: This module can be placed and connected, to a logic structure. The block will activate when a player in gravity steps on it.

Element.Translation: This controller has to be placed next to an activation module for it to work. If a ship or person enters the area blocks connected to this controller, it will activate all activation blocks next to this block.
Element.Original: This controller has to be placed next to an activation module for it to work. If a ship or person enters the area blocks connected to this controller, it will activate all activation blocks next to this block.

You can also choose which block outputs the beam by finding the Damage Beam Module you want to output the beam, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Damage Beam Module, when used in conjunction with a Damage Beam Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Damage Beam fires an energy beam in a straight line. Damage Beams do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the beam by finding the Damage Beam Module you want to output the beam, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: The Damage Pulse Computer is required for creating functioning Damage Pulse systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Damage Pulse Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Damage Pulse Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Damage Pulse Modules. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Damage Pulse Computer is required for creating functioning Damage Pulse systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Damage Pulse Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Damage Pulse Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Damage Pulse Modules. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Damage Pulse Module, when used in conjunction with a Damage Pulse Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Damage Pulse fires an AOE field directly adjacent to the output point. Damage Pulses do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the pulse by finding the Damage Pulse Module you want to output the pulse, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
Element.Original: The Damage Pulse Module, when used in conjunction with a Damage Pulse Computer, can create a basic but effective weapons system. The Damage Pulse fires an AOE field directly adjacent to the output point. Damage Pulses do benefit from being grouped together (being adjacent to one another), increasing their damage. You can also choose which block outputs the pulse by finding the Damage Pulse Module you want to output the pulse, and pressing $ACTIVATE on it.

Element.Translation: The Camera provides another viewpoint. They are automatically connected to the main Ship Core when placed. To cycle through cameras, you can use the Left and Right arrow keys. Cameras also are capable of outputing a docking beam, allowing an alternate docking beam output than from the core itself.
Element.Original: The Camera provides another viewpoint. They are automatically connected to the main Ship Core when placed. To cycle through cameras, you can use the Left and Right arrow keys. Element.Translation:
Warp Gates are a stationary structure that enables players to travel vast distances instantly. Their range is 8 systems (128 sectors). They have a permanent power cost based on their gate size and additionally a one time power cost per ship which passes through the gate. This cost is calculated on the mass of the warping ship. 

Warp Gates are constructed from a 1 block deep ring structure created from Warp Gate Modules. This must then be connected to a Warp Gate Computer. Press C on the computer, then V on the modules to link the two. Alternatively use Shift + V to mass link grouped modules.

After creating both the entry and exit gates at your target departure and destination structures, you must link the two with the Marker Beam. This handheld Support Tool is sold by Trade Guild vendors. Equipping the Marker Beam and Right Clicking on a Warp Gate Computer will Mark the departure structure. Left Clicking on the destination will pair the two and finalise the warp route.
Element.Original:
Warp Gates are a stationary structure that enables players to travel vast distances instantly. Their range is 8 systems (128 sectors). They have a permanent power cost based on their gate size and additionally a one time power cost per ship which passes through the gate. This cost is calculated on the mass of the warping ship. 

Warp Gates are constructed from a 1 block deep ring structure created from Warp Gate Modules. This must then be connected to a Warp Gate Computer. Press C on the computer, then V on the modules to link the two. Alternatively use Shift + V to mass link grouped modules.

After creating both the entry and exit gates at your target departure and destination structures, you must link the two with the Marker Beam. This handheld Support Tool is sold by Trade Guild vendors. Equipping the Marker Beam and Right Clicking on a Warp Gate Computer will Mark the departure structure. Left Clicking on the destination will pair the two and finalise the warp route.

Element.Original:
Warp Gates are a stationary structure that enables players to travel vast distances instantly. Their range is 8 systems (128 sectors). They have a permanent power cost based on their gate size and additionally a one time power cost per ship which passes through the gate. This cost is calculated on the mass of the warping ship. 

Warp Gates are constructed from a 1 block deep ring structure created from Warp Gate Modules. This must then be connected to a Warp Gate Computer. Press C on the computer, then V on the modules to link the two. Alternatively use Shift + V to mass link grouped modules.

After creating both the entry and exit gates at your target departure and destination structures, you must link the two with the Marker Beam. This handheld Support Tool is sold by Trade Guild vendors. Equipping the Marker Beam and Right Clicking on a Warp Gate Computer will Mark the departure structure. Left Clicking on the destination will pair the two and finalise the warp route.

Element.Translation: Jump Drives are the portable version of structures that enable players to warp. You can put them on a ship, charge them up, and instantly travel up to 8 sectors. The destination to jump can be influenced in two ways. Either you jump in the direction you were looking at when engaging the jump drive, or you can use a more precise method. Entering a waypoint in the navigation panel will enable you to jump towards it no matter in which direction you look. It even puts you directly at your waypoint sector if it is fewer than 8 sectors away. Jump Drives can be placed like any other weapon or effect. They will appear in the weapon panel to put in the hotbar for use. Keep in mind that there is a sweet spot for jump Drive modules. You can build them as small as you want, but they will take much longer to charge the up. Placing more blocks than the sweet spot will make charging even faster, if you want a specialized jump ship. But keep the escalating power costs in mind. To charge, you have to hold the left mouse button like shooting a weapon. After it is charged, you can press right click to jump. The mechanic to actively have to charge up the Jump Drive is in place to make it more dangerous to use in battle. The drive has a small 10 second cooldown after jumps. But be warned, changing the blocks on a jump drive will reset the charge immediately. The charge will also be reset if hit, so make sure you are safe before starting to charge up (you can still of course do it while flying).

Element.Translation: The Shield Supply Computer is required for creating functioning Shield Supply systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Shield Supply Modules, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Shield Supply Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Shield Supply Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Shield Supply Computer is required for creating functioning Shield Supply systems. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Shield Supply Modules using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Shield Supply Module. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: These modules can be used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.

Element.Translation: Green Standard Armor that has been emblazoned with white caution stripes.
Element.Original: Green Standard Armor that has been emblazoned with white caution stripes.

Element.Translation: Antennas reduce the time needed to scan. The value is determined by the longest touching group dimension (either X, Y, or Z) versus the longest dimension of the structure it is placed on.
Element.Original: Antennas reduce the time needed to scan. The value is determined by the longest touching group dimension (either X, Y, or Z) versus the longest dimension of the structure it is placed on.

Element.Translation: Antennas reduce the time needed to scan. The value is determined by the longest touching group dimension (either X, Y, or Z) versus the longest dimension of the structure it is placed on.
Element.Original: Antennas reduce the time needed to scan. The value is determined by the longest touching group dimension (either X, Y, or Z) versus the longest dimension of the structure it is placed on.

Element.Translation: A decorative electrical panel displaying statistics.
Element.Original: A decorative electrical panel displaying statistics.

Element.Translation: These forcefield modules can used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Forcefields are significantly more durable than standard Plex or Glass Doors. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.
Element.Original: These forcefield modules can used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Forcefields are significantly more durable than standard Plex or Glass Doors. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.

Element.Translation: This was an old version of stations, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways?? "That's no moon"
Element.Original: This was an old version of stations, it is currently not in use... How did you get this anyways?? "That's no moon"

Element.Translation: This is the basic rail module. As a single block this module works like a docking module. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.
Element.Original: This is the basic rail module. As a single block this module works like a docking module. You can put more of them together to make a track. Use the 'Rail Docker' to dock to this block.

Element.Translation: This is a rail docking module. It is used to dock to a basic rail, a rail rotator, or a Rail Turret Axis. The arrow on its top side works like a magnet aligning itself with the arrow on the block you are docking to. For each docker you can set a docking beam from within your weapon panel. There is no restriction to the size and mass in docking, except overlapping areas are not allowed.
Element.Original: This is a rail docking module. It is used to dock to a basic rail, a rail rotator, or a Rail Turret Axis. The arrow on its top side works like a magnet aligning itself with the arrow on the block you are docking to. For each docker you can set a docking beam from within your weapon panel. There is no restriction to the size and mass in docking, except overlapping areas are not allowed.

Element.Translation: This is the rail rotation module. Whatever goes on to it will rotate by default 90 degrees, and then move on in the given direction if there is another rail block to go to. The degree of rotation can be modified by connecting activation blocks. Connect from the rail rotator up to 9 activation blocks. Each active block will add 45 degrees to its rotation. So it is possible to dynamically change the rotation by just activating and deactivating the activation blocks. Nine active blocks will result in a constant rotation.
Element.Original: This is the rail rotation module. Whatever goes on to it will rotate by default 90 degrees, and then move on in the given direction if there is another rail block to go to. The degree of rotation can be modified by connecting activation blocks. Connect from the rail rotator up to 9 activation blocks. Each active block will add 45 degrees to its rotation. So it is possible to dynamically change the rotation by just activating and deactivating the activation blocks. Nine active blocks will result in a constant rotation.

Element.Translation: This is the turret axis module. Use a Rail Docker to dock to this block. A Rail axis will only move within the axis the block is facing. However, it is possible to chain two of them together to make turrets with full 360 degree freedom.
Element.Original: This is the turret axis module. Use a Rail Docker to dock to this block. A Rail axis will only move within the axis the block is facing. However, it is possible to chain two of them together to make turrets with full 360 degree freedom.

Element.Translation: When activated, this block sends an active logic signal for 0.5 seconds and then deactivates.
Element.Original: When activated, this block sends an active logic signal for 0.5 seconds and then deactivates.

Element.Translation: When this block receives an active signal from another logic block it will toggle on or off.
Element.Original: When this block receives an active signal from another logic block it will toggle on or off.

Element.Translation: Wireless blocks can be linked between seperate entities using C & V to connect them.
Element.Original: Wireless blocks can be linked between seperate entities using C & V to connect them.

Element.Translation: This is the rail rotation module. Whatever goes on to it will rotate by default 90 degrees, and then move on in the given direction if there is another rail block to go to. So it is possible to dynamically change the rotation by just activating and deactivating the activation blocks. Nine active blocks will result in a constant rotation.

Element.Translation:
Optional Block to direct the energy stream 
between your stabilizer and a main reactor.

Connect the nodes to create a path. The stream will
enter from the main reactor to the closest starting
point, and go from the end point to the stabilizer.
Element.Original:
Optional Block to direct the energy stream 
between your stabilizer and a main reactor.

Connect the nodes to create a path. The stream will
enter from the main reactor to the closest starting
point, and go from the end point to the stabilizer.

Element.Translation: This logic block can be named and assigned in the weapons bar to activate logic from within the ship. To assign on the hotbar, the module must be connected to at least one other logic block.
Element.Original: This logic block can be named and assigned in the weapons bar to activate logic from within the ship. To assign on the hotbar, the module must be connected to at least one other logic block.

Element.Translation:
This block is used to combat slow down on rails. 
There is a certain mass free to place on each rail, but in case that is reached, the rail movement will slow down immensly. 
Each 'Rail Mass Enhancer' adds more possible mass to all the rails on your structure but also require power to function.
Element.Original:
This block is used to combat slow down on rails. 
There is a certain mass free to place on each rail, but in case that is reached, the rail movement will slow down immensly. 
Each 'Rail Mass Enhancer' adds more possible mass to all the rails on your structure but also require power to function.

Element.Translation: The rail speed controller is used to manipulate the speed of your rails. Place it down and connect from it to all the rails that should be controlled. Using shift+V in build mode will add all touching rail blocks in the same direction. Then connect any number of activation blocks from the rail speed controller. The number of active blocks in opposition to the number of inactive blocks determines the speed percentage. So 5 active and 5 inactive is 50% of max speed, the same as 100 active and 100 inactive
Element.Original: The rail speed controller is used to manipulate the speed of your rails. Place it down and connect from it to all the rails that should be controlled. Using shift+V in build mode will add all touching rail blocks in the same direction. Then connect any number of activation blocks from the rail speed controller. The number of active blocks in opposition to the number of inactive blocks determines the speed percentage. So 5 active and 5 inactive is 50% of max speed, the same as 100 active and 100 inactive

Element.Translation: A wedge of sturdy scaffolding structure.
Element.Original: A wedge of sturdy scaffolding structure.

Element.Translation:
A shipyard has several features. To access them, just hit R (Activate/Open) on the shipyard, and press the Place Order Button.
Here you can choose from several commands depending on the shipyards current state (e.g. if a ship is docked or not)

The Shipyard computer must be linked to both Shipyard Modules and exactly one Core Anchor to function.
Link the computer and modules using C and V.
Element.Original:
A shipyard has several features. To access them, just hit R (Activate/Open) on the shipyard, and press the Place Order Button.
Here you can choose from several commands depending on the shipyards current state (e.g. if a ship is docked or not)

The Shipyard computer must be linked to both Shipyard Modules and exactly one Core Anchor to function.
Link the computer and modules using C and V.

Element.Translation:
Shipyard Modules build the outer frame and define the usuable build-area of your shipyard.
After selecting your shipyard computer, place down an arc (U shape) of modules. Both end points have to be in line with each other.
Place down duplicate arcs to create a corridor. (The maximal distance from arc to arc is currently 32 blocks).
Element.Original:
Shipyard Modules build the outer frame and define the usuable build-area of your shipyard.
After selecting your shipyard computer, place down an arc (U shape) of modules. Both end points have to be in line with each other.
Place down duplicate arcs to create a corridor. (The maximal distance from arc to arc is currently 32 blocks).

Element.Translation:
Place down exactly one shipyard core anchor anywhere within the arcs internal width / height. You can orientate this block in all 24 directions like a rail block.
This block will align the ships core within your shipyard.
Element.Original:
Place down exactly one shipyard core anchor anywhere within the arcs internal width / height. You can orientate this block in all 24 directions like a rail block.
This block will align the ships core within your shipyard.

Element.Translation:
Basic enhancement for the Jump Drive.

If enabled on the server, this chamber will also enable the Jump Drive on your ship. 
Otherwise it's already available.
Element.Original:
Basic enhancement for the Jump Drive.

If enabled on the server, this chamber will also enable the Jump Drive on your ship. 
Otherwise it's already available.

Element.Translation:
Race gate modules must form a 1 block deep loop to create a working Race Gate. 
To link your Race Gate controller to its Race Gates, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.
Link multiple Race Gates with each other to create a Race Track. Right click the destination Gate with a Marker Beam tool and then left click the source Gate with it.
To create a race on your Race Track. Go to gate you want as starting position and open its Gate Controller Menu. Press the Create new race button and fill in the details.

After that anyone can join the created list by clicking on it and pressing Join Race, you can also remove the race with the Remove Race button. 

When all racers are ready, link an activation controller or button to the starting gates controller. Sending a true signal will start the race. Every racer will see a marker which gate to go through first.
Element.Original:
Race gate modules must form a 1 block deep loop to create a working Race Gate. 
To link your Race Gate controller to its Race Gates, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.
Link multiple Race Gates with each other to create a Race Track. Right click the destination Gate with a Marker Beam tool and then left click the source Gate with it.
To create a race on your Race Track. Go to gate you want as starting position and open its Gate Controller Menu. Press the Create new race button and fill in the details.

After that anyone can join the created list by clicking on it and pressing Join Race, you can also remove the race with the Remove Race button. 

When all racers are ready, link an activation controller or button to the starting gates controller. Sending a true signal will start the race. Every racer will see a marker which gate to go through first.

Element.Translation: Activation Gates are capable of detecting an entity passing through it's Gate structure, sending a True signal to any Logic block linked to the Controller.. The gate must be a solid, 1 block deep ring structure linked to a Activation Gate controller. To link your Activation Gate Controller to the Activation Gate Module structure, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.
Element.Original: Activation Gates are capable of detecting an entity passing through it's Gate structure, sending a True signal to any Logic block linked to the Controller.. The gate must be a solid, 1 block deep ring structure linked to a Activation Gate controller. To link your Activation Gate Controller to the Activation Gate Module structure, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.

Element.Translation:
The Transporter allows you to teleport to other nearby Transporters. Both Transporter Controllers need to be connected to their own Transporter Modules. Each Controller can have multiple Modules.

Default mode is Private, these transporters can only targeted by other transporters on the same entity.
Public Access can be targeted by any transporter in range. Using it however will drop both the shields of the ship you transported from and to.
Faction access can be targeted by any transporter in range that belongs to the same Faction. Shields will also drop on transporting.

To link your Transporter controller to its Transporter Modules, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.
Element.Original:
The Transporter allows you to teleport to other nearby Transporters. Both Transporter Controllers need to be connected to their own Transporter Modules. Each Controller can have multiple Modules.

Public Access can be targeted by any transporter in range. Using it however will drop both the shields of the ship you transported from and to.
Faction access can be targeted by any transporter in range that belongs to the same Faction. Shields will also drop on transporting.

To link your Transporter controller to its Transporter Modules, press C on the Controller, then V on the individual modules, or alternatively Shift + V to mass select grouped modules.

Element.Translation: Cargo Space blocks are used to expand the volume of a chest, this allows you to store more blocks in it. \n\rYou have to link the Storage block to the Cargo Space blocks.
Element.Original: Cargo Space blocks are used to expand the volume of a chest, this allows you to store more blocks in it. \n\rYou have to link the Storage block to the Cargo Space blocks.

Element.Translation: Decreases the power usage of your Warpgates.
Element.Original: Decreases the power usage of your Warpgates.

Element.Translation: Processing Crystal Blocks along with Standard Armor produces Crystal Armor. With a complex crystaline composition, it grants increased health and greater damage reducing properties.
Element.Original: Processing Crystal Blocks along with Standard Armor produces Crystal Armor. With a complex crystaline composition, it grants increased health and greater damage reducing properties.

Element.Translation: Although unarmored and with average health, factories can quickly and easily create Basic Armor by processing a small amount of basic materials.
Element.Original: Although unarmored and with average health, factories can quickly and easily create Basic Armor by processing a small amount of basic materials.

Element.Translation: The Cannon Computer is required for creating functioning Cannon systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Cannon Barrels, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Cannon Barrels using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Cannon Barrel. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.
Element.Original: The Cannon Computer is required for creating functioning Cannon systems. It is capable of controlling any amount of Cannon Barrels, although using multiple groups leads to escalating power costs. Once placed, you can select/deselect it with C, and link Cannon Barrels using V while it is selected and you are looking at a Cannon Barrel. $MAINCOMBI Press $ACTIVATE to get in/out of the Computer.

Element.Translation: The Turret Docking Module functions very similarly to the Docking Module. Except that it allows the docked item to freely rotate, thus enabling turret capabilites. All the other rules and limitations of the Docking Module still apply. You can orient the block and thus the zone, and there must be no other blocks than the docked item in the zone.
Element.Original: The Turret Docking Module functions very similarly to the Docking Module. Except that it allows the docked item to freely rotate, thus enabling turret capabilites. All the other rules and limitations of the Docking Module still apply. You can orient the block and thus the zone, and there must be no other blocks than the docked item in the zone.

Element.Translation: These modules can be used to create doorways that can be opened or closed by the player, docking beams, and logic systems. Multiple adjacent blocks register as one door. Meaning that activating one will activate all other doors touching it. Quite useful for creating large doorways. Press $ACTIVATE to Open/Close.

Element.Translation: The Turret Docking Enhancer can be used for the Turret Docking Module, much like the Docking Enhancer can be for the Docking Module. To use them, you must simply connect them to the Turret Docking Module whose zone you want to increase by selecting the Unit with C, and then using V to connect each Enhancer. As with Weapons, and other blocks that can be connected. The Turret Docking Enhancers do not have to be adjacent to the Turret Docking Module. Alternatively, you can lay a Turret Docking Module down, select it with C, and then each Turret Docking Enhancer you put down afterwards will be automatically connected to the Turret Docking Module. As of now, there is no need to orient Turret Docking Enhancer, as they will increase the Docking Zone all around, no matter which way they are facing, or where they are put in correlation to the Turret Docking Module.
Element.Original: The Turret Docking Enhancer can be used for the Turret Docking Module, much like the Docking Enhancer can be for the Docking Module. To use them, you must simply connect them to the Turret Docking Module whose zone you want to increase by selecting the Unit with C, and then using V to connect each Enhancer. As with Weapons, and other blocks that can be connected. The Turret Docking Enhancers do not have to be adjacent to the Turret Docking Module. Alternatively, you can lay a Turret Docking Module down, select it with C, and then each Turret Docking Enhancer you put down afterwards will be automatically connected to the Turret Docking Module. As of now, there is no need to orient Turret Docking Enhancer, as they will increase the Docking Zone all around, no matter which way they are facing, or where they are put in correlation to the Turret Docking Module.

Element.Original: Further processing of Standard Armor results in Advanced Armor. With a far denser composition, it grants increased health and greater damage reducing properties.

Element.Translation: The Pickup Point block will project a 3x3 detection sphere. When a ship's docking module enters that detection area, the entity will be guided to a Pickup Rail if applicable.\n\rShips will remember the last used Pickup Area modules they dock to and if they're part of a fleet, they'll return to them when the "Carrier Recall" order is issued. The flagship is where they'll try to return, multiple carriers per fleet is not allowed yet.
Element.Original: The Pickup Point block will project a 3x3 detection sphere. When a ship's docking module enters that detection area, the entity will be guided to a Pickup Rail if applicable.\n\rShips will remember the last used Pickup Area modules they dock to and if they're part of a fleet, they'll return to them when the "Carrier Recall" order is issued. The flagship is where they'll try to return, multiple carriers per fleet is not allowed yet.

Element.Translation: Pickup Rails are a non physical, non visible block that functions as a basic rail. To enable automatic docking to it, a Pickup Area module must be placed adjacent to the Pickup Rail.
Element.Original: Pickup Rails are a non physical, non visible block that functions as a basic rail. To enable automatic docking to it, a Pickup Area module must be placed adjacent to the Pickup Rail.

Element.Translation: Shootout Rail blocks will automatically un-dock an entity that moves over it.
Element.Original: Shootout Rail blocks will automatically un-dock an entity that moves over it.
