Element.Translation: Power Auxiliaries are the result of combining Power Capacitors and Power Reactors into a single block. Their power regeneration scales similar to the normal power reactors except that only the group count matters and that their soft cap is also per group. They also have the ability to store power internally. You can turn these Auxiliaries "On" and "Off" by toggling it in your weapons menu. - On: Aux regeneration gets added to the main ship, any internally stored power is drained into the main ship's Power Capacitors. - Off: Aux regeneration charges their own internal power storage at a slow rate. WARNING: These blocks are highly volatile! If a group loses a block, it will create an explosive chain event that can destroy an entire reactor group in less than 2 minutes!
Element.Original: Power Auxiliaries are the result of combining Power Capacitors and Power Reactors into a single block. Their power regeneration scales similar to the normal power reactors except that only the group count matters and that their soft cap is also per group. They also have the ability to store power internally. You can turn these Auxiliaries "On" and "Off" by toggling it in your weapons menu. - On: Aux regeneration gets added to the main ship, any internally stored power is drained into the main ship's Power Capacitors. - Off: Aux regeneration charges their own internal power storage at a slow rate. WARNING: These blocks are highly volatile! If a group loses a block, it will create an explosive chain event that can destroy an entire reactor group in less than 2 minutes!

Element.Translation: This block produces random results when activated. Each time it receives any signal (true or false) it changes its state by a 50:50 chance.
Element.Original: This block produces random results when activated. Each time it receives any signal (true or false) it changes its state by a 50:50 chance.

Element.Translation:
The sensor blocks is used to check the condition of a linked system.
It requires a touching activation block which will be used as output.
It also requires a block linked to the sensor to trigger a check. A clock that periodically sends a signal to the sensor is recommended.

Link the sensor to any of these blocks:
- power reactors
- power auxiliaries
- shields
- doors/force fields
- radar jammer
- cloaker
- jump drive
- cargo

The sensor has a default state of 0%. Meaning that it will trigger for blocks in an "off" state or for systems that are depleted such as 0 power or 0 volume used.

You can link the sensor to a number of activation modules to set any % other than 0. It works like a rail speed controller using ratios. 3 true linked activation modules out of 6 will set it to 50%.
Element.Original:
The sensor blocks is used to check the condition of a linked system.
It requires a touching activation block which will be used as output.
It also requires a block linked to the sensor to trigger a check. A clock that periodically sends a signal to the sensor is recommended.

Link the sensor to any of these blocks:
- power reactors
- power auxiliaries
- shields
- doors/force fields
- radar jammer
- cloaker
- jump drive
- cargo

The sensor has a default state of 0%. Meaning that it will trigger for blocks in an "off" state or for systems that are depleted such as 0 power or 0 volume used.

You can link the sensor to a number of activation modules to set any % other than 0. It works like a rail speed controller using ratios. 3 true linked activation modules out of 6 will set it to 50%.

Element.Translation: Enables permanent usage of your Scanner at the cost of always consuming power.
Element.Original: Enables permanent usage of your Scanner at the cost of always consuming power.

Element.Translation: Increases the strength of your Jump Inhibitor.
Element.Original: Increases the strength of your Jump Inhibitor.

Element.Translation: Reactor Chamber to enable mass modifying effects.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.
Element.Original: Reactor Chamber to enable mass modifying effects.\n\rNeeds to be physically connected with a Power Reactor by using Reactor Conduit blocks.

Element.Translation: Reduces the drain on your shields when using a transporter.
Element.Original: Reduces the drain on your shields when using a transporter.

Element.Original: Increases the recharge speed of your Scanner.

Element.Original: Autoassign weapons on fire if bar empty

Element.Translation: Lifetime (secs) of debris (0 to turn off)
Element.Original: Lifetime (secs) of debris (0 to turn off)

Element.Original: Use linear mag filter on Blocks (restart required)

Element.Translation:
Greetings space traveller!

My name is %s, I'm currently part of %s,
and under the command of %s in the faction: %s.
Element.Original:
Greetings space traveller!

My name is %s, I'm currently part of %s,
and under the command of %s in the faction: %s.

Element.Translation: I want you in my team.
Element.Original: I want you in my team.

Element.Translation: I want you off my team. Stay where you are!
Element.Original: I want you off my team. Stay where you are!

Element.Translation: I'm honoured to work with you, commander!
Element.Original: I'm honoured to work with you, commander!

Element.Translation:
The traiding guild is the biggest trading company of the known universe.
On your travels you will probably encounter us in one or another way.
We have shops where we buy and sell various goods, but we also utilize a fleet to restock
shops, and defend ourselves. 

While we are by priciple neutral, we will respond if you fire at our shops, or breach the shields
of our vessels. But don't worry: we won't be mad at you for long should you survive.
Element.Original:
The traiding guild is the biggest trading company of the known universe.
On your travels you will probably encounter us in one or another way.
We have shops where we buy and sell various goods, but we also utilize a fleet to restock
shops, and defend ourselves. 

While we are by priciple neutral, we will respond if you fire at our shops, or breach the shields
of our vessels. But don't worry: we won't be mad at you for long should you survive.

Element.Translation: I want to know more about the traiding guild
Element.Original: I want to know more about the traiding guild

Element.Translation: What kind of information do you need?
Element.Original: What kind of information do you need?

Element.Translation: This will cost you 50,000 credits. Are you sure?
Element.Original: This will cost you 50,000 credits. Are you sure?

Element.Translation: I want to know something else
Element.Original: I want to know something else

Element.Translation:
The pirates are the pest of the universe.
It's better to not engage then unless you absolutely must. Use your navigator often to check for hostiles.
There are rumors that they build their own bases, and even copy ship blueprints,
but only few have survived to tell the story. 

You can outrun the pirates and they usually stop pursuing if you get 1-2 sector clicks away.
Element.Original:
The pirates are the pest of the universe.
It's better to not engage then unless you absolutely must. Use your navigator often to check for hostiles.
There are rumors that they build their own bases, and even copy ship blueprints,
but only few have survived to tell the story. 

You can outrun the pirates and they usually stop pursuing if you get 1-2 sector clicks away.

Element.Translation: I need something for my suit
Element.Original: I need something for my suit

Element.Translation: I want to know something else
Element.Original: I want to know something else

Element.Translation:
This is an advaced shop.
The more common version of shops are not manned by member of the trading guild,
but utilize a fully automatic shop system. You can also buy your own shopping block right here,
to use the same technique on your own stations

Here you can also buy recipes for various purposes. Either to create a block, or a fixed recipe
to convert blocks. 

Feel free to browse (press 'B' after this converation has ended)
Element.Original:
This is an advaced shop.
The more common version of shops are not manned by member of the trading guild,
but utilize a fully automatic shop system. You can also buy your own shopping block right here,
to use the same technique on your own stations

Here you can also buy recipes for various purposes. Either to create a block, or a fixed recipe
to convert blocks. 

Feel free to browse (press 'B' after this converation has ended)

Element.Translation: I want to know more about shops
Element.Original: I want to know more about shops

Element.Translation: I want to know something else
Element.Original: I want to know something else

Element.Translation:
Greetings, space traveler.

My name is %s, and I'm a member of the intergalactic traiding Guild.
You can get information, quests, and more.

How can I help you?
Element.Original:
Greetings, space traveler.

My name is %s, and I'm a member of the intergalactic traiding Guild.
You can get information, quests, and more.

How can I help you?

Element.Translation:
Ah, great! That's much better!

Now let's go over some basics:
As long as you are talking or a tutorial window is open, you can't perform any actions.
However, there will be plenty of interactive steps where you can freely move around and try things out.
You will see that an interactive step is coming up if "(press next to take control)" appears
in the tutorial window.
Element.Original:
Ah, great! That's much better!

Now let's go over some basics:
As long as you are talking or a tutorial window is open, you can't perform any actions.
However, there will be plenty of interactive steps where you can freely move around and try things out.
You will see that an interactive step is coming up if "(press next to take control)" appears
in the tutorial window.

Element.Translation:
We saved all the stuff you had in your inventory, you'll get it back when you complete or exit the tutorial.
We're going to give you some things along the way too.

Those are placed either in your quick bar, or when that is full, in your inventory.
You can open the inventory with 'I' and drag blocks
and items into your quick bar at the bottom.
Then you can either use the mouse wheel or keyboard numbers to select the
item you want to use.
Element.Original:
We saved all the stuff you had in your inventory, you'll get it back when you complete or exit the tutorial.
We're going to give you some things along the way too.

Those are placed either in your quick bar, or when that is full, in your inventory.
You can open the inventory with 'I' and drag blocks
and items into your quick bar at the bottom.
Then you can either use the mouse wheel or keyboard numbers to select the
item you want to use.

Element.Translation:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-1 to start the next part of this tutorial!

Have a good tick!
Element.Original:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-1 to start the next part of this tutorial!

Have a good tick!

Element.Translation: All right, show me the way!
Element.Original: All right, show me the way!

Element.Translation:
Greetings %s, I'm "NPC-01"!

I will teach you about one of the most important things in the StarMade Universe: Ships!
Element.Original:
Greetings %s, I'm "NPC-01"!

I will teach you about one of the most important things in the StarMade Universe: Ships!

Element.Translation:
Block count is not all that matters, the architecture and design also has an important role on the effectiveness
and efficiency of every structure in StarMade.

For now we are only talking about Ships.
Element.Original:
Block count is not all that matters, the architecture and design also has an important role on the effectiveness
and efficiency of every structure in StarMade.

For now we are only talking about Ships.

Element.Translation: The Ship Core is important, got it!
Element.Original: The Ship Core is important, got it!

Element.Translation:
Every ship has a core. A core is the heart of a ship, and without it the ship will not
function, so be sure to protect it at any cost.

Additionally the core block will serve as your vessel's point of control,
so be sure you keep that in mind when building.
Element.Original:
Every ship has a core. A core is the heart of a ship, and without it the ship will not
function, so be sure to protect it at any cost.

Additionally the core block will serve as your vessel's point of control,
so be sure you keep that in mind when building.

Element.Translation:
That over there is a small pre-built ship. The core is at the centre.
You can enter the core by pressing 'R', and take control of the ship.
Element.Original:
That over there is a small pre-built ship. The core is at the centre.
You can enter the core by pressing 'R', and take control of the ship.

Element.Translation:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-02 for the next steps in the tutorial!

Have a good time!
Element.Original:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-02 for the next steps in the tutorial!

Have a good time!

Element.Translation:
Ah %s, you made it!
I'm "NPC-02"!

Now that you know how to fly a ship, I will teach you how to build one.
Element.Original:
Ah %s, you made it!
I'm "NPC-02"!

Now that you know how to fly a ship, I will teach you how to build one.

Element.Translation:
There are various ways to acquire a ship. Buy one from the blueprint catalogue,
steal one, defeat one, get one as a gift, and of course build one yourself!
You can build as many as you like!
A good ship builder can construct ships that dominate any other ship of equal size,
but let's start with the basics.
Element.Original:
There are various ways to acquire a ship. Buy one from the blueprint catalogue,
steal one, defeat one, get one as a gift, and of course build one yourself!
You can build as many as you like!
A good ship builder can construct ships that dominate any other ship of equal size,
but let's start with the basics.

Element.Translation:
A ship needs two essential systems to be usable: Power and Thrust.
Place both types on your ship and you will be able to fly.
Keep in mind, the more thrust modules you place, the more power you will need
and the faster you'll accelerate!
Element.Original:
A ship needs two essential systems to be usable: Power and Thrust.
Place both types on your ship and you will be able to fly.
Keep in mind, the more thrust modules you place, the more power you will need
and the faster you'll accelerate!

Element.Translation:
I will give you a core, a few power modules and a thruster.
To spawn that core, just press 'X' and name it. Be sure there is enough space
in front of you, so don't look at the ground while doing this.

Let me remove this pre-made ship real quick for you.
Element.Original:
I will give you a core, a few power modules and a thruster.
To spawn that core, just press 'X' and name it. Be sure there is enough space
in front of you, so don't look at the ground while doing this.

Let me remove this pre-made ship real quick for you.

Element.Translation:
Well done %s, you are a fast learner!
Now, let's check out how weapons and other systems work on ships.
There are several weapons to choose from, as well as several systems,
most importantly the salvage beam and the laser cannon.
Element.Original:
Well done %s, you are a fast learner!
Now, let's check out how weapons and other systems work on ships.
There are several weapons to choose from, as well as several systems,
most importantly the salvage beam and the laser cannon.

Element.Translation:
The salvage beam lets you take blocks and mine minerals from a safe distance.
It's also much faster than picking up those blocks by hand, and will increase efficiency with salvage beam size.

The laser cannon is your basic defence and does more damage the bigger it is.
You can also make different versions of it, like a shotgun or a machine gun type.
I'll explain how that works later.
Element.Original:
The salvage beam lets you take blocks and mine minerals from a safe distance.
It's also much faster than picking up those blocks by hand, and will increase efficiency with salvage beam size.

The laser cannon is your basic defence and does more damage the bigger it is.
You can also make different versions of it, like a shotgun or a machine gun type.
I'll explain how that works later.

Element.Translation:
Luckily on ships, if you put them down in the right order, you
won't have to do any manual connecting at all!
Element.Original:
Luckily on ships, if you put them down in the right order, you
won't have to do any manual connecting at all!

Element.Translation:
If you place a cannon computer or any other controller on a ship, it is automatically connected to the
core. After you place a computer, each cannon barrel is automatically linked, unless you select
something else.

Go ahead, give it a shot. I'll give you a computer and some barrels. Place the computer first and then
place the barrels. After you're happy with it, press 'T' to open the weapons panel.
Element.Original:
If you place a cannon computer or any other controller on a ship, it is automatically connected to the
core. After you place a computer, each cannon barrel is automatically linked, unless you select
something else.

Go ahead, give it a shot. I'll give you a computer and some barrels. Place the computer first and then
place the barrels. After you're happy with it, press 'T' to open the weapons panel.

Element.Translation:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-3 for the next steps in the tutorial!

Have a good tick!
Element.Original:
I've taught you everything I know.
Talk to NPC-3 for the next steps in the tutorial!

Have a good tick!

Element.Translation:
Hello there! Welcome to the advanced class!

I've heard from NPC-02 that you have already built your first ship!
That's really impressive!
Element.Original:
Hello there! Welcome to the advanced class!

I've heard from NPC-02 that you have already built your first ship!
That's really impressive!

Element.Translation:
Now this is the system everyone in our universe is using: the controller system!
Understanding this system is the key to make anything functional in this world!
Element.Original:
Now this is the system everyone in our universe is using: the controller system!
Understanding this system is the key to make anything functional in this world!

Element.Translation: What kind of new weapons can I create?
Element.Original: What kind of new weapons can I create?

Element.Translation:
Here's how it works:
Almost all functional blocks come in two types: A controller and modules.

Each module on a structure is used by the controller it is connected to.
Element.Original:
Here's how it works:
Almost all functional blocks come in two types: A controller and modules.

Each module on a structure is used by the controller it is connected to.

Element.Translation:
So if you place a Cannon Computer (the controller) down,
the cannon barrels (modules) that are connected to it will fire when you use the controller!

It's the computer that controls the cannons as one object on the quick bar.
Element.Original:
So if you place a Cannon Computer (the controller) down,
the cannon barrels (modules) that are connected to it will fire when you use the controller!

It's the computer that controls the cannons as one object on the quick bar.

Element.Translation: First, you need to fix this connection for me. This cannon should fire automatically,\nbut they are not linked.
Element.Original: First, you need to fix this connection for me. This cannon should fire automatically,\nbut they are not linked.

Element.Translation:
This information can give you an edge over your opponent, so listen closely:

As you may have noticed when you flew those ships back there, the laser cannon has a fairly
long reload time. There is actually a way to change that!
And the best thing is, you can apply the same knowledge to any other weapon out there.
Element.Original:
This information can give you an edge over your opponent, so listen closely:

As you may have noticed when you flew those ships back there, the laser cannon has a fairly
long reload time. There is actually a way to change that!
And the best thing is, you can apply the same knowledge to any other weapon out there.

Element.Translation:
This is how it works:

If you have two computers with each having their own connected modules, you can actually link
those two computers together to create a powerful combination weapon.

You forfeit the ability to fire both weapons separately for a single, more powerful weapon

Depending on which weapon system you "slave" to another, the results will differ.
Element.Original:
This is how it works:

If you have two computers with each having their own connected modules, you can actually link
those two computers together to create a powerful combination weapon.

You forfeit the ability to fire both weapons separately for a single, more powerful weapon

Depending on which weapon system you "slave" to another, the results will differ.

Element.Translation:
Here are some of the most common examples:

- A 'Cannon Computer' slave will increase firing speed.
- A 'Missile Computer' slave will fire more projectiles.
- A 'Damage Beam Computer' will increase range and/or speed.
- A 'Damage Pulse Computer' will increase the damage dealt.

There are a lot of combinations.

I prepared an example for you over there! We are going to turn this cannon into a shotgun.
Element.Original:
Here are some of the most common examples:

- A 'Cannon Computer' slave will increase firing speed.
- A 'Missile Computer' slave will fire more projectiles.
- A 'Damage Beam Computer' will increase range and/or speed.
- A 'Damage Pulse Computer' will increase the damage dealt.

There are a lot of combinations.

I prepared an example for you over there! We are going to turn this cannon into a shotgun.

Element.Translation:
Just two more basic things to learn and you are done.
You need something to defend yourself without a ship.

I'll tell you about using personal weapons.
Element.Original:
Just two more basic things to learn and you are done.
You need something to defend yourself without a ship.

I'll tell you about using personal weapons.

Element.Translation: I'll give you a laser pistol, sniper rifle and a rocket launcher.\nJust hit 'I' to open your inventory and drag them to your quick bar.\n
Element.Original: I'll give you a laser pistol, sniper rifle and a rocket launcher.\nJust hit 'I' to open your inventory and drag them to your quick bar.\n

Element.Translation: Then, you just have to select the slot and left click to use them.\n\nTry them out over there, at the shooting range.
Element.Original: Then, you just have to select the slot and left click to use them.\n\nTry them out over there, at the shooting range.

Element.Translation: I've taught you everything I know.\nTalk to NPC-5 for the last lesson!
Element.Original: I've taught you everything I know.\nTalk to NPC-5 for the last lesson!

Element.Translation:
This is the last and most important lesson: Crafting
It's the best way to make money and anything you'll need in this world.

The crafting is based on a tree, with raw resources at the bottom. Almost every block has a recipe,
that is based on those raw resources. There are two main types of raw materials: crystal shards and ore.
You can process them into generic materials and capsules:

- Generic materials are alloyed metal meshes and crystal circuits. They can be used to make anything basic.
- Advanced materials are capsules. They are specific and needed for the more advanced recipes.
Element.Original:
This is the last and most important lesson: Crafting
It's the best way to make money and anything you'll need in this world.

The crafting is based on a tree, with raw resources at the bottom. Almost every block has a recipe,
that is based on those raw resources. There are two main types of raw materials: crystal shards and ore.
You can process them into generic materials and capsules:

- Generic materials are alloyed metal meshes and crystal circuits. They can be used to make anything basic.
- Advanced materials are capsules. They are specific and needed for the more advanced recipes.

Element.Translation:
You can mine resources by hand just fine, but it's a lot more efficient using a salvage ship.
Also, you can process raw resources with your tools embedded in your astronaut suit.
It's much more efficient to use a factory block for that though!

Especially when refining raw resources, you won't get any capsules and less generic materials
if you don't use the Capsule Refinery block for that.
Element.Original:
You can mine resources by hand just fine, but it's a lot more efficient using a salvage ship.
Also, you can process raw resources with your tools embedded in your astronaut suit.
It's much more efficient to use a factory block for that though!

Especially when refining raw resources, you won't get any capsules and less generic materials
if you don't use the Capsule Refinery block for that.

Element.Translation:
You can produce the basic factory block with your suit's tools as well.

The basic factory makes the capsule refinery as well as the standard factory for
more advanced crafting. There is even an advanced factory, which in turn is produced
in the standard factory.

Should you not have a power block for your factories, you can use your power supply tool to power
it, so you can make a few blocks in emergencies . That's what we are going to do now: Produce a power
block from scratch!
Element.Original:
You can produce the basic factory block with your suit's tools as well.

The basic factory makes the capsule refinery as well as the standard factory for
more advanced crafting. There is even an advanced factory, which in turn is produced
in the standard factory.

Should you not have a power block for your factories, you can use your power supply tool to power
it, so you can make a few blocks in emergencies . That's what we are going to do now: Produce a power
block from scratch!

Element.Translation: I've taught you everything I know.\nCheck around the station. There are still a lot of NPCs around that will tell you\nuseful information!When you are done, just hit ESC and hit the 'Exit Tutorial' button.
Element.Original: I've taught you everything I know.\nCheck around the station. There are still a lot of NPCs around that will tell you\nuseful information!When you are done, just hit ESC and hit the 'Exit Tutorial' button.

Element.Translation:
A real awesome thing you can do is docking your ships!
You can use a turret docking block or a normal docking block for that.
Just aim your docking beam (it comes equipped with every ship core), at the docking block.

You can increase the docking area by connecting docking enhancers to the docking blocks,
but keep in mind that they all have to touch, as only the largest group counts.

You can also give your ship or turret an Artificial Intelligence. Make sure the ship or turret has your faction signature
by placing and activating a faction block. Then place down a bobby AI block and activate it. You can also
activate AI for turrets directly in the structure panel of the ship the turrets are docked to.
Element.Original:
A real awesome thing you can do is docking your ships!
You can use a turret docking block or a normal docking block for that.
Just aim your docking beam (it comes equipped with every ship core), at the docking block.

You can increase the docking area by connecting docking enhancers to the docking blocks,
but keep in mind that they all have to touch, as only the largest group counts.

You can also give your ship or turret an Artificial Intelligence. Make sure the ship or turret has your faction signature
by placing and activating a faction block. Then place down a bobby AI block and activate it. You can also
activate AI for turrets directly in the structure panel of the ship the turrets are docked to.

Element.Translation: Man, I really don't like using the consoles on this station! The hardware just isn't as good as on the\nstuff you build yourself, and it's cheaper too...
Element.Original: Man, I really don't like using the consoles on this station! The hardware just isn't as good as on the\nstuff you build yourself, and it's cheaper too...

Element.Translation:
Check out this cool display behind me!

You can put in any text you like and even use different colours, sizes and variables from your ship
like the current power supply.
Element.Original:
Check out this cool display behind me!

You can put in any text you like and even use different colours, sizes and variables from your ship
like the current power supply.

Element.Translation:
You learned about combinations back there. NPC-03 thinks it's such a secret, but in reality everybody knows it!

In fact, he doesn't even know everything about it. There is actually a second system you can connect to your weapons
in the same way you are combining weapons: Effects!

Now, you can place effects and use them as a defensive standalone system, they can harden your shields,
increase top speed and much more.

You can also connect them to your weapons, which then will give that weapon an effect amongst others like armour efficiency, power drain
and even physical effects like push, pull, and stop, so you can make your very own tractor beam!

Oh and one last tip: You can colour your weapon projectiles or beams by connecting a coloured light to them. Easy as that!
Element.Original:
You learned about combinations back there. NPC-03 thinks it's such a secret, but in reality everybody knows it!

In fact, he doesn't even know everything about it. There is actually a second system you can connect to your weapons
in the same way you are combining weapons: Effects!

Now, you can place effects and use them as a defensive standalone system, they can harden your shields,
increase top speed and much more.

You can also connect them to your weapons, which then will give that weapon an effect amongst others like armour efficiency, power drain
and even physical effects like push, pull, and stop, so you can make your very own tractor beam!

Oh and one last tip: You can colour your weapon projectiles or beams by connecting a coloured light to them. Easy as that!

Element.Translation: The system design in this world really matters.\nFor example, if you set up power in the right way, you can get a huge recharge bonus.
Element.Original: The system design in this world really matters.\nFor example, if you set up power in the right way, you can get a huge recharge bonus.

Element.Translation:
Hello there.
I really love being in the trading guild, but there are other awesome factions out there!

You can even create your own in the faction panel.
Having a faction is especially useful when you are in the same universe as other humans like you.
You have news posts, ranks, settings, and what is most important: A home base.
Home bases can't be destroyed normally, so it's the perfect place to dock your ship to,
as it will get the same protection as the base.

Each faction can only have one home base though, so choose its location carefully.

But, home bases are not the only great thing about factions. You can also claim whole star systems as your
territory. Mining in your territory will give you a 12x mining yield bonus and you'll also receive a message
every time a human enters one of your systems. Your scan range is increased as well!

Territory doesn't come for free though. You have to pay for them with Faction Points [FP]. Check out the faction
point reports in your faction panel. You can later also use faction points to create missions and temporarily protect stations other
than your own home base. If you spend too many on territory or your faction members die too often, you will lose territory
and in the end even your home base can become vulnerable, but that rarely happens if you don't take a risk.
The first territory is also free!
Element.Original:
Hello there.
I really love being in the trading guild, but there are other awesome factions out there!

You can even create your own in the faction panel.
Having a faction is especially useful when you are in the same universe as other humans like you.
You have news posts, ranks, settings, and what is most important: A home base.
Home bases can't be destroyed normally, so it's the perfect place to dock your ship to,
as it will get the same protection as the base.

Each faction can only have one home base though, so choose its location carefully.

But, home bases are not the only great thing about factions. You can also claim whole star systems as your

every time a human enters one of your systems. Your scan range is increased as well!

Territory doesn't come for free though. You have to pay for them with Faction Points [FP]. Check out the faction

than your own home base. If you spend too many on territory or your faction members die too often, you will lose territory
and in the end even your home base can become vulnerable, but that rarely happens if you don't take a risk.
The first territory is also free!

Element.Translation: Check this cool contraption I made. You can pretty much do anything with the logic blocks, as they\nwork just like electrical circuits.
Element.Original: Check this cool contraption I made. You can pretty much do anything with the logic blocks, as they\nwork just like electrical circuits.

Element.Translation:
Hi! I'll tell you how to navigate in this universe!

Once you have a ship, open up the galaxy map with P, and you will see the whole galaxy.
The Universe is subdivided into sectors, systems (16x16x16 sectors), and galaxies (128x128x128 systems).
So one galaxy is pretty big already, but there are quadrillions of them, not lying.
It's very important to know your way around.

You can check all the objects close to you in the navigation panel and set manual way points to any sector.
The navigation also has a function that lets you track the last ship you were in.
Element.Original:
Hi! I'll tell you how to navigate in this universe!

Once you have a ship, open up the galaxy map with P, and you will see the whole galaxy.
The Universe is subdivided into sectors, systems (16x16x16 sectors), and galaxies (128x128x128 systems).
So one galaxy is pretty big already, but there are quadrillions of them, not lying.
It's very important to know your way around.

You can check all the objects close to you in the navigation panel and set manual way points to any sector.
The navigation also has a function that lets you track the last ship you were in.

Element.Translation: Hi, I hope you enjoy your stay in this world!\nIt has a lot to offer.
Element.Original: Hi, I hope you enjoy your stay in this world!\nIt has a lot to offer.

Element.Translation:
Hi there!

 Do you want to sit like me? Just press 'O' on any surface.
The closest edge to where you are looking at determines which direction you'll sit!

Try it out on the chair at the other side of the table.
Element.Original:
Hi there!

 Do you want to sit like me? Just press 'O' on any surface.
The closest edge to where you are looking at determines which direction you'll sit!

Try it out on the chair at the other side of the table.

Element.Translation: When you go out exploring, you will find some abandoned stations. I've heard you can either\nsalvage them for scrap metal, or even repair them to use as your own station.However...I've also heard stories of something lurking in there, but I don't believe a word of that.
Element.Original: When you go out exploring, you will find some abandoned stations. I've heard you can either\nsalvage them for scrap metal, or even repair them to use as your own station.However...I've also heard stories of something lurking in there, but I don't believe a word of that.

Element.Translation: how much credits do shops gain about every 10 min
Element.Original: how much credits do shops gain about every 10 min

Element.Translation: how much credits do shops start with
Element.Original: how much credits do shops start with

Element.Translation: Advanced shops will have 4 rails dockers that can be used like a neutral homebase (anything docked is safe)
Element.Original: Advanced shops will have 4 rails dockers that can be used like a neutral homebase (anything docked is safe)

Element.Translation: Normal shops will have 4 rails dockers that can be used like a neutral homebase (anything docked is safe)
Element.Original: Normal shops will have 4 rails dockers that can be used like a neutral homebase (anything docked is safe)

Element.Translation: Cost to reboot a ship at a shop (per second it would take to reboot in space)
Element.Original: Cost to reboot a ship at a shop (per second it would take to reboot in space)

Element.Translation: minimum of base price a shop will want depending on its stock (e.g. max 80 credits if the normal cost is 100)
Element.Original: minimum of base price a shop will want depending on its stock (e.g. max 80 credits if the normal cost is 100)

Element.Translation: maximum of base price a shop will want depending on its stock (e.g. max 120 credits if the normal cost is 100)
Element.Original: maximum of base price a shop will want depending on its stock (e.g. max 120 credits if the normal cost is 100)

Element.Translation: (must be between 0 and 1): 0 is no shops spawned in asteroid sectors, 1 is shop spawned in everyone (default: 8% -> 0.08)
Element.Original: (must be between 0 and 1): 0 is no shops spawned in asteroid sectors, 1 is shop spawned in everyone (default: 8% -> 0.08)

Element.Translation: shop buy and sell price change depending on stock (shop prices will always stay the same if true)
Element.Original: shop buy and sell price change depending on stock (shop prices will always stay the same if true)

Element.Translation: How much seconds between simulation spawn ticks
Element.Original: How much seconds between simulation spawn ticks

Element.Translation: Trading guild will deliver stock to shops
Element.Original: Trading guild will deliver stock to shops

Element.Translation: if off, skin uploading to server is deactivated
Element.Original: if off, skin uploading to server is deactivated

Element.Translation: how fast should skins be transferred from server to clients (too high might cause lag) [default 256 ~ 16kb/s]
Element.Original: how fast should skins be transferred from server to clients (too high might cause lag) [default 256 ~ 16kb/s]

Element.Translation: buffer size of incoming and outgoing data per socket
Element.Original: buffer size of incoming and outgoing data per socket

Element.Translation: megabyte limit of .data file when to use NIO (faster) (must be power of 2)
Element.Original: megabyte limit of .data file when to use NIO (faster) (must be power of 2)

Element.Translation: how much does a station or station blueprint cost
Element.Original: how much does a station or station blueprint cost

Element.Translation: Super admin password for this server
Element.Original: Super admin password for this server

Element.Translation: Enable super admin for this server
Element.Original: Enable super admin for this server

Element.Translation: Naggles algorithm (WARNING: only change when you know what you're doing)
Element.Original: Naggles algorithm (WARNING: only change when you know what you're doing)

Element.Translation: How fast ships, etc. may go in m/s . Too high values may induce physics tunneling effects
Element.Original: How fast ships, etc. may go in m/s . Too high values may induce physics tunneling effects

Element.Translation: how long is a 'day' (stellar system rotation) in milliseconds (-1 to switch off system rotation)
Element.Original: how long is a 'day' (stellar system rotation) in milliseconds (-1 to switch off system rotation)

Element.Translation: use recipe based prices (the price is the price of the parts it is made out of in crafting)
Element.Original: use recipe based prices (the price is the price of the parts it is made out of in crafting)

Element.Translation: Use 'fog of war'. Turning this off will make everything visible to everyone
Element.Original: Use 'fog of war'. Turning this off will make everything visible to everyone

Element.Translation: enables spawning of old style pirate stations
Element.Original: enables spawning of old style pirate stations

Element.Translation: ships and other structures use the hitpoint system. if off, a ship will overheat when the core gets taken out (old)
Element.Original: ships and other structures use the hitpoint system. if off, a ship will overheat when the core gets taken out (old)

Element.Translation: Use 'User Datagram Protocol' (UDP) instead of 'Transmission Control Protocol' (TCP) for connections
Element.Original: Use 'User Datagram Protocol' (UDP) instead of 'Transmission Control Protocol' (TCP) for connections

Element.Translation: only names/ips from whitelist.txt are allowed
Element.Original: only names/ips from whitelist.txt are allowed

Element.Translation: Reference distance for weapon ranges. (what blockBehaviorConfig.xml weapon ranges are multiplied with (usually the sector size)). Set to 1 to interpret weapon ranges in the config in meters
Element.Original: Reference distance for weapon ranges. (what blockBehaviorConfig.xml weapon ranges are multiplied with (usually the sector size)). Set to 1 to interpret weapon ranges in the config in meters

Element.Translation: if on, the center of mass for each structured will be calculated based on block mass. On 'false', the center of mass is always the core position
Element.Original: if on, the center of mass for each structured will be calculated based on block mass. On 'false', the center of mass is always the core position

Element.Translation: set world to use (set 'old' for using the old world). if no world exists a new one will be set automatically
Element.Original: set world to use (set 'old' for using the old world). if no world exists a new one will be set automatically

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;End
Element.Translation: This concludes the Basic Logic Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Basic Logic Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;Start
Element.Translation: Welcome to the Basic Logic Tutorial.
Element.Original: Welcome to the Basic Logic Tutorial.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateA
Element.Translation: StarMade has a fully integrated, Turing complete logic system.\nThis means you could build a fully functional CPU\nwithin StarMade.
Element.Original: StarMade has a fully integrated, Turing complete logic system.\nThis means you could build a fully functional CPU\nwithin StarMade.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateB
Element.Translation:
The system works by connecting
blocks with each other to create
basic circuits similar to electronic ones.
These circuits are called 'logic gates'.
Element.Original:
The system works by connecting
blocks with each other to create
basic circuits similar to electronic ones.
These circuits are called 'logic gates'.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateC
Element.Translation:
The most important block in the logic system
is the 'Activation Block'. This block can be
turned on and off by pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
It can also share this on/off signal to all the blocks
that are connected with it.
Element.Original:
The most important block in the logic system
is the 'Activation Block'. This block can be
turned on and off by pressing $ACTIVATE on it.
It can also share this on/off signal to all the blocks
that are connected with it.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateC1
Element.Translation: To connect a block, press $SELECT_MODULE on one activation\nblock to select it, and $CONNECT_MODULE on the block you want to\nconnect it to.
Element.Original: To connect a block, press $SELECT_MODULE on one activation\nblock to select it, and $CONNECT_MODULE on the block you want to\nconnect it to.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateD
Element.Translation:
When you place an activation block,
and connect it to another activation block,
both blocks will be activated if you press $ACTIVATE
on the first one.
Activation blocks can also be linked to doors, lights,
weapon computers, and anything else that can be
activated in Starmade.
Element.Original:
When you place an activation block,
and connect it to another activation block,
both blocks will be activated if you press $ACTIVATE
on the first one.
Activation blocks can also be linked to doors, lights,
weapon computers, and anything else that can be
activated in Starmade.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_A basic tutorial about the logic system;StateE
Element.Translation: They can also be linked to gravity modules,\nalthough the activation block needs to be directly linked\nto the gravity module at this moment.
Element.Original: They can also be linked to gravity modules,\nalthough the activation block needs to be directly linked\nto the gravity module at this moment.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Advanced Build Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Advanced Build Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.Translation: Welcome to the Advanced Building Tutorial!\nHere you will learn how to use the tools\nto make building a lot faster and easier
Element.Original: Welcome to the Advanced Building Tutorial!\nHere you will learn how to use the tools\nto make building a lot faster and easier

Element.Translation: You can only access the advanced building\nmode in a ship core or build block.
Element.Original: You can only access the advanced building\nmode in a ship core or build block.

Element.Translation:
The first useful feature is the left shift button,
It will let you move a lot faster
(as opposed to
slower in astronaut mode).
Element.Original:
The first useful feature is the left shift button,
It will let you move a lot faster
(as opposed to
slower in astronaut mode).

Element.Translation:
While in build mode, hold down $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM
to activate the advanced build mode.
You will see several options
on the right side of your screen.
Element.Original:
While in build mode, hold down $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM
to activate the advanced build mode.
You will see several options
on the right side of your screen.

Element.Translation:
While holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM ,
you can place/remove blocks by directly clicking on blocks
with your mouse cursor.
Each tool will now be explained...
Element.Original:
While holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM ,
you can place/remove blocks by directly clicking on blocks
with your mouse cursor.
Each tool will now be explained...

Element.Translation:
Remove mode turns the yellow build box
into a red one that shows you what blocks
are going to be removed.
This is especially helpful for removing
larger areas.
Element.Original:
Remove mode turns the yellow build box
into a red one that shows you what blocks
are going to be removed.
This is especially helpful for removing
larger areas.

Element.Translation:
Lighten mode removes any shadows and
shading from the blocks, lighting
up dark areas to make it easier
to see when building. Keep in mind
to disable it once in a while to see
how good your ship looks with lighting enabled.
Element.Original:
Lighten mode removes any shadows and
shading from the blocks, lighting
up dark areas to make it easier
to see when building. Keep in mind
to disable it once in a while to see
how good your ship looks with lighting enabled.

Element.Translation:
The three sliders are one of the best tools
for building. They will increase the build area
so multiple blocks can be build/removed at once.
Servers have different max settings, and you
can set them for your single player game
in the server.cfg file.
Element.Original:
The three sliders are one of the best tools
for building. They will increase the build area
so multiple blocks can be build/removed at once.
Servers have different max settings, and you
can set them for your single player game
in the server.cfg file.

Element.Translation:
Orientation is available if a rotatable block
is selected. Those blocks
are either blocks with individual sides
or special shapes like wedges.
You can also rotate through the block orientations
with the mouse wheel while holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM
Element.Original:
Orientation is available if a rotatable block
is selected. Those blocks
are either blocks with individual sides
or special shapes like wedges.
You can also rotate through the block orientations
with the mouse wheel while holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM

Element.Translation:
Whenever you accidentally misplaced
or deleted a block, you can undo your
last actions by clicking on 'undo'.
You can also redo by clicking on 'redo'.
Element.Original:
Whenever you accidentally misplaced
or deleted a block, you can undo your
last actions by clicking on 'undo'.
You can also redo by clicking on 'redo'.

Element.Translation:
Symmetry planes are probably the best tools in the game.
You place down 'walls' that divide your structure in parts.
Placing a block on one side will also place the
block on the other side. 'odd' symmetry just lets you
move the wall to the middle of a block.
You can use multiple symmetry planes to
maximize your building speed.
Element.Original:
Symmetry planes are probably the best tools in the game.
You place down 'walls' that divide your structure in parts.
Placing a block on one side will also place the
block on the other side. 'odd' symmetry just lets you
move the wall to the middle of a block.
You can use multiple symmetry planes to
maximize your building speed.

Element.Translation:
Mirror mode basically just tells
symmetry mode to also mirror
blocks that can be orientated
like weapons, etc...
Element.Original:
Mirror mode basically just tells
symmetry mode to also mirror
blocks that can be orientated
like weapons, etc...

Element.Translation:
The remove filter is a great tool to quickly refit your ship!
You can select a block from the drop down menu
(or use the filter above to search for specific names) and only
the selected block will be removed when right clicking.
This works with larger build areas and symmetry.
Element.Original:
The remove filter is a great tool to quickly refit your ship!
You can select a block from the drop down menu
(or use the filter above to search for specific names) and only
the selected block will be removed when right clicking.
This works with larger build areas and symmetry.

Element.Translation: This concludes the AI Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the AI Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.Translation:
Welcome to the AI Tutorial.
This tutorial will teach you about
the AI functionality in StarMade
and how to use it.
Element.Original:
Welcome to the AI Tutorial.
This tutorial will teach you about
the AI functionality in StarMade
and how to use it.

Element.Translation: StarMade offers two modes for AI\nat this moment: Ship and Turret. More\nfunctions will be added.
Element.Original: StarMade offers two modes for AI\nat this moment: Ship and Turret. More\nfunctions will be added.

Element.Translation:
To build an AI controlled ship,
you have to place down an AI module
on it.
A structure can only have ONE AI Module,
so make sure it's protected well.
Element.Original:
To build an AI controlled ship,
you have to place down an AI module
on it.
A structure can only have ONE AI Module,
so make sure it's protected well.

Element.Translation:
You can change the settings of
the AI module by pressing
'$ACTIVATE' on it.
A panel with all the options will appear.
Element.Original:
You can change the settings of
the AI module by pressing
'$ACTIVATE' on it.
A panel with all the options will appear.

Element.Translation:
The best way to operate AI is
to be in a faction, as then the
AI knows exactly who your enemies are.
They function without a faction too.
Element.Original:
The best way to operate AI is
to be in a faction, as then the
AI knows exactly who your enemies are.
They function without a faction too.

Element.Translation: Depending on what you want to use it for,\nset your AI to 'ship' or 'turret'. Turrets will\nnot use their thrusters.
Element.Original: Depending on what you want to use it for,\nset your AI to 'ship' or 'turret'. Turrets will\nnot use their thrusters.

Element.Translation:
Next, you can set their behaviour.
Aim at 'Any' means it will attack any enemy in range.
Aim at 'Selected Target' is only relevant for turrets
and means that those will attack the targeted entity, the
pilot of the mother ship selects an entity with '$SELECT_LOOK_ENTITY'
Element.Original:
Next, you can set their behaviour.
Aim at 'Any' means it will attack any enemy in range.
Aim at 'Selected Target' is only relevant for turrets
and means that those will attack the targeted entity, the
pilot of the mother ship selects an entity with '$SELECT_LOOK_ENTITY'

Element.Translation: To activate the AI, you have to tick off 'Activate'.\nRe-entering that ship core will disable the AI!
Element.Original: To activate the AI, you have to tick off 'Activate'.\nRe-entering that ship core will disable the AI!

Element.Translation:
You can also do it from the comfort of your
ship by opening the structure panel.
Press $STRUCTURE_PANEL and select the
docked entity you want to turn on or off.
You can also turn on/off all docked entities at
once in the structure panel.
Element.Original:
You can also do it from the comfort of your
ship by opening the structure panel.
Press $STRUCTURE_PANEL and select the
docked entity you want to turn on or off.
You can also turn on/off all docked entities at
once in the structure panel.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Ship System Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Ship System Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!

Element.Translation: Welcome to the Ship System Tutorial
Element.Original: Welcome to the Ship System Tutorial

Element.Translation: StarMade uses a system to quickly\ncalculate ship systems and their\nconnections, as well as groups of a particular blocks.
Element.Original: StarMade uses a system to quickly\ncalculate ship systems and their\nconnections, as well as groups of a particular blocks.

Element.Translation:
A lot of systems work best in block-groups.
A block-group consists of two or more
blocks of the same type that are all touching each other.
A solid big cube of blocks is an example of a block-group,
but the same goes for a line.
Element.Original:
A lot of systems work best in block-groups.
A block-group consists of two or more
blocks of the same type that are all touching each other.
A solid big cube of blocks is an example of a block-group,
but the same goes for a line.

Element.Translation:
For some systems, it is more efficient
to arrange the groups in a certain way.
The power recharge system uses this type, allowing the player
to construct a powerful reactor as efficient as possible.
Element.Original:
For some systems, it is more efficient
to arrange the groups in a certain way.
The power recharge system uses this type, allowing the player
to construct a powerful reactor as efficient as possible.

Element.Translation:
In this case, the dimension of the block-groups matter.
This means that a solid big cube of
recharge power modules gives a lot less energy than the same
amount of blocks, laid out in a giant three-dimensional cross.
Element.Original:
In this case, the dimension of the block-groups matter.
This means that a solid big cube of
recharge power modules gives a lot less energy than the same
amount of blocks, laid out in a giant three-dimensional cross.

Element.Translation:
Another example for block-groups are the weapon modules.
Each group of weapons will fire one projectile.
You can either have one big group, or multiple
weaker small ones. Keep in mind that you'll
receive a penalty, depending on
how many separate weapon groups you have.
Element.Original:
Another example for block-groups are the weapon modules.
Each group of weapons will fire one projectile.
You can either have one big group, or multiple
weaker small ones. Keep in mind that you'll
receive a penalty, depending on
how many separate weapon groups you have.

Element.Translation: This concludes the AI Crew Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the AI Crew Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.Translation: Welcome to the AI Crew Tutorial.\nThis tutorial explains how to get\nand control your AI crew
Element.Original: Welcome to the AI Crew Tutorial.\nThis tutorial explains how to get\nand control your AI crew

Element.Translation:
The use of AI is part of a bigger
picture that is still a work in progress,
you can already hire and use your own AI
crew.
Element.Original:
The use of AI is part of a bigger
picture that is still a work in progress,
you can already hire and use your own AI
crew.

Element.Translation:
At this moment, hiring crew can only be done
at an advanced shop. Those shops are located in
the starting sector of new worlds but also
spawn randomly, although more rarely than normal shops.
To find them, check your navigation panel
for Trading guild NPCs during your travels.
Element.Original:
At this moment, hiring crew can only be done
at an advanced shop. Those shops are located in
the starting sector of new worlds but also
spawn randomly, although more rarely than normal shops.
To find them, check your navigation panel
for Trading guild NPCs during your travels.

Element.Translation: An advanced shop has an NPC, which\nyou can talk to with $ACTIVATE. He lets you hire\nup to 5 NPCs.
Element.Original: An advanced shop has an NPC, which\nyou can talk to with $ACTIVATE. He lets you hire\nup to 5 NPCs.

Element.Translation:
That doesn't mean that you can only get 5 in total.
However, you can only have 5 at a time that follow
your direct commands.
You can discharge NPCs to your ship and get more.
They will wait for you. Just press $ACTIVATE on one of
your crew members and tell him to wait or join you.
Element.Original:
That doesn't mean that you can only get 5 in total.
However, you can only have 5 at a time that follow
your direct commands.
You can discharge NPCs to your ship and get more.
They will wait for you. Just press $ACTIVATE on one of
your crew members and tell him to wait or join you.

Element.Translation:
You can control your NPCs by
pressing '$AI_CONTROL_KEY'. A list of your
NPCs will appear to the left and
you can select the one you want to
give commands to.
Element.Original:
You can control your NPCs by
pressing '$AI_CONTROL_KEY'. A list of your
NPCs will appear to the left and
you can select the one you want to
give commands to.

Element.Translation:
Note that NPCs have a "home" they
belong to (like a ship). To attach them
to your ship, tell them to follow you.
Then go to your ship and tell them to go to a
point on your ship. This will make the ship
their new 'home', and they will move with it.
Element.Original:
Note that NPCs have a "home" they
belong to (like a ship). To attach them
to your ship, tell them to follow you.
Then go to your ship and tell them to go to a
point on your ship. This will make the ship
their new 'home', and they will move with it.

Element.Translation: In the AI panel ('$AI_CONFIG_PANEL'), click on the Crew tab.\nHere you can rename your AI crew and remove them if needed.
Element.Original: In the AI panel ('$AI_CONFIG_PANEL'), click on the Crew tab.\nHere you can rename your AI crew and remove them if needed.

Element.Translation: You can also change their behaviour\nin the AI panel.
Element.Original: You can also change their behaviour\nin the AI panel.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Docking Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Docking Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.Translation:
Welcome to the Docking Tutorial.
This tutorial explains how to build
docking areas, and how to dock ships
and turrets
Element.Original:
Welcome to the Docking Tutorial.
This tutorial explains how to build
docking areas, and how to dock ships
and turrets

Element.Translation:
To dock, you need a "fixed docking module",
or a "turret docking module". When placing it
down, you can change its orientation in the
advanced build mode.
Element.Original:
To dock, you need a "fixed docking module",
or a "turret docking module". When placing it
down, you can change its orientation in the
advanced build mode.

Element.Translation:
When it is placed down, you should see the docking
area. If it is not green, then something is
blocking it. A docking area must be completely
free from any block.
Element.Original:
When it is placed down, you should see the docking
area. If it is not green, then something is
blocking it. A docking area must be completely
free from any block.

Element.Translation:
You can increase the size of the area
by linking docking enhancer blocks to it.
Just press $SELECT_MODULE on the docking
module and place down some enhancers.
The size is determined by the shape of
its enhancers. They must be placed in connecting groups.
Element.Original:
You can increase the size of the area
by linking docking enhancer blocks to it.
Just press $SELECT_MODULE on the docking
module and place down some enhancers.
The size is determined by the shape of
its enhancers. They must be placed in connecting groups.

Element.Translation:
A ship is docked at the centre relative to
its size. The ship core will appear right above the docking port
and all parts sticking out must fit in the green area.
A turret needs to have its core on the bottom.
That means you cannot build below
the core if you want to use it as a turret.
Element.Original:
A ship is docked at the centre relative to
its size. The ship core will appear right above the docking port
and all parts sticking out must fit in the green area.
A turret needs to have its core on the bottom.
That means you cannot build below
the core if you want to use it as a turret.

Element.Translation:
To dock, select the docking beam (which also
activates doors and other activatable blocks)
and shoot it on the docking block.
Right click will ignore doors so you can dock
without closing them instead.
Element.Original:
To dock, select the docking beam (which also
activates doors and other activatable blocks)
and shoot it on the docking block.
Right click will ignore doors so you can dock
without closing them instead.

Element.Translation:
If you have problems with docking,
dock a single core, and then build on
it from its docked position to fully
understand how the docking area system works.
If you build on a docked ship, un-docking
and re-docking might change its position.
Element.Original:
If you have problems with docking,
dock a single core, and then build on
it from its docked position to fully
understand how the docking area system works.
If you build on a docked ship, un-docking
and re-docking might change its position.

Element.Translation: You can also chain-dock multiple ships\ntogether, but you cannot dock anything\non a turret yet.
Element.Original: You can also chain-dock multiple ships\ntogether, but you cannot dock anything\non a turret yet.

Element.Translation:
For turrets to be AI controlled,
you have to have the turret factioned with
the faction block and also equip it with an AI Module.
Press $ACTIVATE on it to make sure it is set to 'turret',
then you can either activate it there, or do the same
from the structure panel.
Element.Original:
For turrets to be AI controlled,
you have to have the turret factioned with
the faction block and also equip it with an AI Module.
Press $ACTIVATE on it to make sure it is set to 'turret',
then you can either activate it there, or do the same
from the structure panel.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Navigation Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Navigation Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!

Element.Translation:
The universe is a big place.
Travelling to other places
salvaging important locations and meeting new players
is vital to survive.
Element.Original:
The universe is a big place.
Travelling to other places
salvaging important locations and meeting new players
is vital to survive.

Element.Translation:
You are currently in a sector.
A sector is composed of 3 coordinates to indicate where
it is located in the universe.
These coordinates are visible on top
of the GUI near your name.
Element.Original:
You are currently in a sector.
A sector is composed of 3 coordinates to indicate where
it is located in the universe.
These coordinates are visible on top
of the GUI near your name.

Element.Translation: A System is a big collection of sectors, 16 by 16 by 16 sectors\nto be exact. In the middle of each system\nis almost always a star located.
Element.Original: A System is a big collection of sectors, 16 by 16 by 16 sectors\nto be exact. In the middle of each system\nis almost always a star located.

Element.Translation:
You can look at all the objects in your vicinity
by pressing $NAVIGATION_PANEL. The filter will
help you organize it
by disabling or enabling certain objects. Clicking on an
object in the list will select it in your HUD.
Element.Original:
You can look at all the objects in your vicinity
by pressing $NAVIGATION_PANEL. The filter will
help you organize it
by disabling or enabling certain objects. Clicking on an
object in the list will select it in your HUD.

Element.Translation:
To make a waypoint for a specific sector,
press the 'waypoint' button and enter
the coordinates of the sector you want
to travel to. This waypoint will now
be shown as a white blinking indication on your HUD.
Element.Original:
To make a waypoint for a specific sector,
press the 'waypoint' button and enter
the coordinates of the sector you want
to travel to. This waypoint will now
be shown as a white blinking indication on your HUD.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Weapon System Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Weapon System Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.Translation: Welcome to the Weapon System Tutorial.\nThis tutorial explains how to use and customize\nyour weapons.
Element.Original: Welcome to the Weapon System Tutorial.\nThis tutorial explains how to use and customize\nyour weapons.

Element.Translation:
StarMade has four main weapon types at this point.
Antimatter Cannons, Missiles, Damage Pulse
and Damage Beam. Each weapon is useful on its own
but in most situations a specific weapon
will be the most effective.
Element.Original:
StarMade has four main weapon types at this point.
Antimatter Cannons, Missiles, Damage Pulse
and Damage Beam. Each weapon is useful on its own
but in most situations a specific weapon
will be the most effective.

Element.Translation:
StarMade uses a combination system for this.
You can link two main computers together to
change how the weapon behaves.
Each weapon has a secondary effect, that will
be applied to the weapon it is linked to.
Element.Original:
StarMade uses a combination system for this.
You can link two main computers together to
change how the weapon behaves.
Each weapon has a secondary effect, that will
be applied to the weapon it is linked to.

Element.Translation:
Secondary effects:
Cannons: Makes the weapon reload faster (machine-gun).
Missile: Splits up the weapon into smaller parts (shotgun).
Pulse: Increases the weapon damage (High calibre).
Beam: Makes the weapon range greater and and the
projectile faster (sniper).
Element.Original:
Secondary effects:
Cannons: Makes the weapon reload faster (machine-gun).
Missile: Splits up the weapon into smaller parts (shotgun).
Pulse: Increases the weapon damage (High calibre).
Beam: Makes the weapon range greater and and the
projectile faster (sniper).

Element.Translation:
As mentioned before, you have to connect
two weapon computers together to combine them.
Both weapon computers have to have
weapon modules connected to them.
Element.Original:
As mentioned before, you have to connect
two weapon computers together to combine them.
Both weapon computers have to have
weapon modules connected to them.

Element.Translation:
The ratio of connected blocks on each of
the connected systems determines how much
of the secondary effect the main weapon will
receive.
The damage however will be determined by the total block
count from all weapon blocks.
Element.Original:
The ratio of connected blocks on each of
the connected systems determines how much
of the secondary effect the main weapon will
receive.
The damage however will be determined by the total block
count from all weapon blocks.

Element.Translation:
Example, a weapon that uses 50 blocks in
combination with another weapon that uses 50
blocks has the same damage per second as a single weapon
with 100 blocks.
Element.Original:
Example, a weapon that uses 50 blocks in
combination with another weapon that uses 50
blocks has the same damage per second as a single weapon
with 100 blocks.

Element.Translation:
Try this now. Place down a weapon computer
and connect 5 weapon modules to it.
Next, place another weapon computer down
and connect 5 weapon modules to that.
Element.Original:
Try this now. Place down a weapon computer
and connect 5 weapon modules to it.
Next, place another weapon computer down
and connect 5 weapon modules to that.

Element.Translation:
Now press $SELECT_MODULE on the weapon
computer you want to use as your main weapon.
Finally press $CONNECT_MODULE on the second weapon computer.
The coloured boxes around the computers will now
indicate its connection.
Element.Original:
Now press $SELECT_MODULE on the weapon
computer you want to use as your main weapon.
Finally press $CONNECT_MODULE on the second weapon computer.
The coloured boxes around the computers will now
indicate its connection.

Element.Translation:
You can also do the same with the 'drag and drop' feature
in the weapon menu (open with $WEAPON_PANEL). Just pick
a weapon and drag it into the slave slot of another.
You can also unlink by selecting a slave and dropping
it in the unlink box.
Element.Original:
You can also do the same with the 'drag and drop' feature
in the weapon menu (open with $WEAPON_PANEL). Just pick
a weapon and drag it into the slave slot of another.
You can also unlink by selecting a slave and dropping
it in the unlink box.

Element.Translation:
Your cannon will now fire 15 times faster
but each shot will do less damage.
The total DPS will be the same as one cannon computer
with 10 cannon modules linked to it.
Element.Original:
Your cannon will now fire 15 times faster
but each shot will do less damage.
The total DPS will be the same as one cannon computer
with 10 cannon modules linked to it.

Element.Translation:
If you connect 7 blocks to the main computer and
3 to the secondary, you will only get around half
of the reload buff but each shot will do more damage.
The DPS remains unchanged.
This way you can fully customize your weapon.
Element.Original:
If you connect 7 blocks to the main computer and
3 to the secondary, you will only get around half
of the reload buff but each shot will do more damage.
The DPS remains unchanged.
This way you can fully customize your weapon.

Element.Translation: Keep in mind that the weapon computer can only be used in\nONE combination at a time, so choose wisely what you want.
Element.Original: Keep in mind that the weapon computer can only be used in\nONE combination at a time, so choose wisely what you want.

Element.Translation: You can also add effect blocks to a weapon computer,\nwhich will change the type of damage you are doing.\nThis will be covered in the 'Effects Tutorial'.
Element.Original: You can also add effect blocks to a weapon computer,\nwhich will change the type of damage you are doing.\nThis will be covered in the 'Effects Tutorial'.

Element.Translation: Additionally you can link light sources to your weapon,\nto change the colour of that weapon's projectile.
Element.Original: Additionally you can link light sources to your weapon,\nto change the colour of that weapon's projectile.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;End
Element.Translation: This concludes the Advanced Logic Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Advanced Logic Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;Start
Element.Translation:
Welcome to the Advanced Logic Tutorial.
In the basic tutorial, you were introduced to the
activation block, which is the most vital block
in the system. Here you will learn about all
the other blocks used in logic and its triggers.
Element.Original:
Welcome to the Advanced Logic Tutorial.
In the basic tutorial, you were introduced to the
activation block, which is the most vital block
in the system. Here you will learn about all
the other blocks used in logic and its triggers.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateA
Element.Translation:
As you now know, you can link blocks together
to make a chain to remote control
the block at the end. You can build
a lot more complex things though.
This is where the NOT, OR, AND, and DELAY blocks
come into play.
Element.Original:
As you now know, you can link blocks together
to make a chain to remote control
the block at the end. You can build
a lot more complex things though.
This is where the NOT, OR, AND, and DELAY blocks
come into play.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateB
Element.Translation:
Every one of these blocks can be linked just
like the activation blocks.
The simplest one to understand is probably the NOT block.
What it does is simply inverting an incoming signal
from 'on' to 'off' and vice versa.
Element.Original:
Every one of these blocks can be linked just
like the activation blocks.
The simplest one to understand is probably the NOT block.
What it does is simply inverting an incoming signal
from 'on' to 'off' and vice versa.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateC
Element.Translation:
The more complicated blocks are the
AND and OR blocks.
Those blocks will need multiple inputs.
The inputs can by any logic blocks, even OR and AND
themselves.
Element.Original:
The more complicated blocks are the
AND and OR blocks.
Those blocks will need multiple inputs.
The inputs can by any logic blocks, even OR and AND
themselves.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateD
Element.Translation: AND will look at all the blocks that are\nconnected to it and only output the 'on'\nsignal when ALL of the receiving signals are 'on'.
Element.Original: AND will look at all the blocks that are\nconnected to it and only output the 'on'\nsignal when ALL of the receiving signals are 'on'.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateE
Element.Translation: OR will look at all the blocks that are\nconnected to it and only output the 'on'\nsignal when ONE or more of the receiving signals is 'on'.
Element.Original: OR will look at all the blocks that are\nconnected to it and only output the 'on'\nsignal when ONE or more of the receiving signals is 'on'.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateF
Element.Translation:
Now to the delay block.
The delay block takes a signal on/off and
outputs it just like the activation block.
However, it will not do this immediately
but with a delay.
Element.Original:
Now to the delay block.
The delay block takes a signal on/off and
outputs it just like the activation block.
However, it will not do this immediately
but with a delay.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateG
Element.Translation: The delay block enables players to build\nlooped systems like clocks, and many more\ncomplex circuits.
Element.Original: The delay block enables players to build\nlooped systems like clocks, and many more\ncomplex circuits.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_More about the logic system and its blocks;StateH
Element.Translation: There are several internet sites to look up basic\nlogic gates. You can rebuild these in StarMade.
Element.Original: There are several internet sites to look up basic\nlogic gates. You can rebuild these in StarMade.

Element.Translation: Follow me and talk to NPC-01!
Element.Original: Follow me and talk to NPC-01!

Element.Translation:
Follow the flashing indicator/arrow to come
over and talk to me!
(You can exit the tutorial at any time later
from the main menu (press ESC))
Element.Original:
Follow the flashing indicator/arrow to come
over and talk to me!
(You can exit the tutorial at any time later
from the main menu (press ESC))

Element.Translation: Welcome to starmade, $PLAYER!, my name is "NPC-00"
Element.Original: Welcome to starmade, $PLAYER!, my name is "NPC-00"

Element.Translation: I'm over here! Come talk to me so I don't\nhave to use the radio.\nI suppose you need to get your bearings!
Element.Original: I'm over here! Come talk to me so I don't\nhave to use the radio.\nI suppose you need to get your bearings!

Element.Translation:
The mouse controls your camera, use it to look around.
$FORWARD and $BACKWARDS control your forwards and backwards movements.
$STRAFE_LEFT and $STRAFE_RIGHT control your left and right movements.
'$JUMP' lets you jump when in gravity!
Element.Original:
The mouse controls your camera, use it to look around.
$FORWARD and $BACKWARDS control your forwards and backwards movements.
$STRAFE_LEFT and $STRAFE_RIGHT control your left and right movements.
'$JUMP' lets you jump when in gravity!

Element.Translation: Great!\nCome back to talk to me.
Element.Original: Great!\nCome back to talk to me.

Element.Translation: ####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####\nI'm going to let you try out the controls for a bit now!
Element.Original: ####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####\nI'm going to let you try out the controls for a bit now!

Element.Translation:
Take as long as you like!
You can activate blocks with '$ACTIVATE'
try it out on the lights and the gravity module
under the red light block.
Element.Original:
Take as long as you like!
You can activate blocks with '$ACTIVATE'
try it out on the lights and the gravity module
under the red light block.

Element.Translation: This is zero gravity.\nYou can move up with $UP\nand down with $DOWN.
Element.Original: This is zero gravity.\nYou can move up with $UP\nand down with $DOWN.

Element.Translation:
You can also align yourself to any structure with
the space bar. This comes in very handy when entering a ship
through narrow corridors.
When aligned, you will also fly with the ship
if it's moving.
Element.Original:
You can also align yourself to any structure with
the space bar. This comes in very handy when entering a ship
through narrow corridors.
When aligned, you will also fly with the ship
if it's moving.
