Element.Translation: Alright!\nPress '$ACTIVATE' again on the gravity\nmodule to reactivate the gravity.
Element.Original: Alright!\nPress '$ACTIVATE' again on the gravity\nmodule to reactivate the gravity.

Element.Translation: Fly over to NPC-02\n(Exit ship with '$ENTER_SHIP')\n(Walk over if you exit the ship)
Element.Original: Fly over to NPC-02\n(Exit ship with '$ENTER_SHIP')\n(Walk over if you exit the ship)

Element.Translation: I prepared a ship for you behind that door!\nYou can enter it with 'R'
Element.Original: I prepared a ship for you behind that door!\nYou can enter it with 'R'

Element.Translation: Great! You are now in build mode of the ship!
Element.Original: Great! You are now in build mode of the ship!

Element.Translation: There are two modes:\n- Build Mode, to efficiently build a ship\n- Flight Mode, to fly your ship and fire weapons
Element.Original: There are two modes:\n- Build Mode, to efficiently build a ship\n- Flight Mode, to fly your ship and fire weapons

Element.Translation: Switch now to flight mode by pressing\nthe space bar.
Element.Original: Switch now to flight mode by pressing\nthe space bar.

Element.Translation:
Great, on the sides you now see your ship's status
bars.
Also keep in mind that the bigger a ship is, the longer
it will take to turn.
Element.Original:
Great, on the sides you now see your ship's status
bars.
Also keep in mind that the bigger a ship is, the longer
it will take to turn.

Element.Translation:
Your ship HP depend on how many 'System' blocks
like power, weapons, or shields you have on your ship.
When you lose those blocks, your HP will go down, which has
several negative effects.
Your ship will start overheating at 50%. At that point you will
have to decide if you want to try to rescue your ship or flee.
Element.Original:
Your ship HP depend on how many 'System' blocks
like power, weapons, or shields you have on your ship.
When you lose those blocks, your HP will go down, which has
several negative effects.
Your ship will start overheating at 50%. At that point you will
have to decide if you want to try to rescue your ship or flee.

Element.Translation:
To reset your HP to 100% you will have to 'reboot' your systems.
This can be done by pressing '$REBOOT_SYSTEMS' in build mode. Rebooting takes
time depending on your lost HP and ship size, but can also be done
instantly on shops for credits.
When overheating you cannot enter the ship again until rebooted.
At this point you will be promted to reboot if you try to enter
the core.
Element.Original:
To reset your HP to 100% you will have to 'reboot' your systems.
This can be done by pressing '$REBOOT_SYSTEMS' in build mode. Rebooting takes
time depending on your lost HP and ship size, but can also be done
instantly on shops for credits.
When overheating you cannot enter the ship again until rebooted.
At this point you will be promted to reboot if you try to enter
the core.

Element.Translation:
Armor follows the same principle as structure HP, with the
difference that different blocks provide it, and that you can
only reset it to 100% on shops for credits.
Armor absorbs 50% of all damage as long as you have any armor left.
Element.Original:
Armor follows the same principle as structure HP, with the
difference that different blocks provide it, and that you can
only reset it to 100% on shops for credits.
Armor absorbs 50% of all damage as long as you have any armor left.

Element.Translation:
Press $FORWARD $BACKWARDS $STRAFE_LEFT $STRAFE_RIGHT and $UP $DOWN to use your thrusters.
Use Left Shift to slow down.
With the mouse wheel and number keys you can
select your weapon or tool from the hot bar.
There are 10 hotbars for weapons. Hold control
and mouse wheel scroll through them, or press
contol + number key to switch directly.
Element.Original:
Press $FORWARD $BACKWARDS $STRAFE_LEFT $STRAFE_RIGHT and $UP $DOWN to use your thrusters.
Use Left Shift to slow down.
With the mouse wheel and number keys you can
select your weapon or tool from the hot bar.
There are 10 hotbars for weapons. Hold control
and mouse wheel scroll through them, or press
contol + number key to switch directly.

Element.Translation: You can also rearrange them, or\nassign new weapons to your hotbar\nin the weapons menu by pressing '$WEAPON_PANEL'
Element.Original: You can also rearrange them, or\nassign new weapons to your hotbar\nin the weapons menu by pressing '$WEAPON_PANEL'

Element.Translation: Let's see if you can make\nyour way over to NPC-02 over on the\nother side of this area
Element.Original: Let's see if you can make\nyour way over to NPC-02 over on the\nother side of this area

Element.Translation: Ok, now please come talk to me!\n(Exit ship with '$ENTER_SHIP' while not looking at your ship)
Element.Original: Ok, now please come talk to me!\n(Exit ship with '$ENTER_SHIP' while not looking at your ship)

Element.Translation: ####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####\nNow let's build a ship from the scratch!
Element.Original: ####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####\nNow let's build a ship from the scratch!

Element.Translation: Spawn a ship with '$SPAWN_SHIP' and give it a name.\n(don't look at ground/walls because\nthe core needs space to spawn)
Element.Original: Spawn a ship with '$SPAWN_SHIP' and give it a name.\n(don't look at ground/walls because\nthe core needs space to spawn)

Element.Translation: Awesome! Now you can enter your first\nship with '$ENTER_SHIP'
Element.Original: Awesome! Now you can enter your first\nship with '$ENTER_SHIP'

Element.Translation:
This is build mode. It's best to build in this mode,
as you can accelerate movement with Right Shift, and
pass through anything. You are also always aligned to
this ship, and of course you can use the advanced
build tools.
Element.Original:
This is build mode. It's best to build in this mode,
as you can accelerate movement with Right Shift, and
pass through anything. You are also always aligned to
this ship, and of course you can use the advanced
build tools.

Element.Translation: Now let's make your ship flyable first.\nPlace the power and thruster anywhere on your ship.
Element.Original: Now let's make your ship flyable first.\nPlace the power and thruster anywhere on your ship.

Element.Translation: Place a power module\nanywhere on your ship\n(left click)
Element.Original: Place a power module\nanywhere on your ship\n(left click)

Element.Translation: Now, place a thruster\nmodule anywhere on your ship\n(left click)
Element.Original: Now, place a thruster\nmodule anywhere on your ship\n(left click)

Element.Translation:
Very nice!
Note, that you can save a blueprint of a ship at any time
in the 'Catalog', buy a copy of it at any shop
and then spawn it by just providing
the necessary blocks.
Just press '$CATALOG_PANEL' to open the catalog panel.
You can even bring your own creations
into other universes (multiplayer servers).
Element.Original:
Very nice!
Note, that you can save a blueprint of a ship at any time
in the 'Catalog', buy a copy of it at any shop
and then spawn it by just providing
the necessary blocks.
Just press '$CATALOG_PANEL' to open the catalog panel.
You can even bring your own creations
into other universes (multiplayer servers).

Element.Translation:
Well done! Try out your weapon
for a bit and then go over to
NPC-03 for the advanced class!
(Exit ship with '$ACTIVATE')
Element.Original:
Well done! Try out your weapon
for a bit and then go over to
NPC-03 for the advanced class!
(Exit ship with '$ACTIVATE')

Element.Translation: Press '$CHANGE_SHIP_MODE' to enter build mode again.
Element.Original: Press '$CHANGE_SHIP_MODE' to enter build mode again.

Element.Translation: Place the cannon computer now.\n(left click)
Element.Original: Place the cannon computer now.\n(left click)

Element.Translation: Good work! You see that it now has an orange\npulsating border around it. That means it's\ncurrently selected.
Element.Original: Good work! You see that it now has an orange\npulsating border around it. That means it's\ncurrently selected.

Element.Translation:
Place some 'cannon barrel modules' now. You can place them
all next to each other for a single, high-damage
beam, or place them separate from one another to
shoot multiple projectiles at once.
Element.Original:
Place some 'cannon barrel modules' now. You can place them
all next to each other for a single, high-damage
beam, or place them separate from one another to
shoot multiple projectiles at once.

Element.Translation: Now, place the cannon barrels on your ship.\n(left click)
Element.Original: Now, place the cannon barrels on your ship.\n(left click)

Element.Translation: Great work. The only thing left is to assign\nyour new cannon in the weapon panel.
Element.Original: Great work. The only thing left is to assign\nyour new cannon in the weapon panel.

Element.Translation: Open your weapons panel with '$WEAPON_PANEL'\n(only accessible in a ship)
Element.Original: Open your weapons panel with '$WEAPON_PANEL'\n(only accessible in a ship)

Element.Translation:
This is the weapon panel!
You can assign controllers to your
hotbar here, as well as manage
advanced combined weapons.
Element.Original:
This is the weapon panel!
You can assign controllers to your
hotbar here, as well as manage
advanced combined weapons.

Element.Translation: When new weapons are added, you will open\nthis menu to assign weapons to each slot in\nyour hotbar.
Element.Original: When new weapons are added, you will open\nthis menu to assign weapons to each slot in\nyour hotbar.

Element.Translation: Drag the cannon computer on top\nin the first (1) slot of your hotbar\nat the bottom
Element.Original: Drag the cannon computer on top\nin the first (1) slot of your hotbar\nat the bottom

Element.Translation: Awesome! You can now close the weapon\npanel. (Press '$WEAPON_PANEL' or click on the X)
Element.Original: Awesome! You can now close the weapon\npanel. (Press '$WEAPON_PANEL' or click on the X)

Element.Translation: Almost done. Now switch\ninto flight mode with 'Space'\nif you aren't already.
Element.Original: Almost done. Now switch\ninto flight mode with 'Space'\nif you aren't already.

Element.Translation:
You're done! You can now select
your weapon by pressing '1'
or select it with the mouse wheel
if it isn't selected already
Element.Original:
You're done! You can now select
your weapon by pressing '1'
or select it with the mouse wheel
if it isn't selected already

Element.Translation:
Now lets go to the last stage
of the tutorial:
Meet NPC-04 for information about
crafting and personal weapons
Element.Original:
Now lets go to the last stage
of the tutorial:
Meet NPC-04 for information about
crafting and personal weapons

Element.Translation:
Those two computers
in that other room
are just a cannon and a missile.
Nothing special!
Element.Original:
Those two computers
in that other room
are just a cannon and a missile.
Nothing special!

Element.Translation: See, what happens if you 'slave'\nthe missile to the\ncannon.
Element.Original: See, what happens if you 'slave'\nthe missile to the\ncannon.

Element.Translation: Check it out! The cannon is now a\nshotgun!\nOh and I forgot something important...
Element.Original: Check it out! The cannon is now a\nshotgun!\nOh and I forgot something important...

Element.Translation:
The effect is based on the ratio
of the two weapons.
Since the ratio of these two weapons
are 1 to 1, the resultant effect is
100%.
Element.Original:
The effect is based on the ratio
of the two weapons.
Since the ratio of these two weapons
are 1 to 1, the resultant effect is
100%.

Element.Translation:
But if you had 1 missile module
connected to 100 cannon modules,
the resultant shotgun effect would
only be 1%.
Element.Original:
But if you had 1 missile module
connected to 100 cannon modules,
the resultant shotgun effect would
only be 1%.

Element.Translation:
A combined weapon will always have the
same damage per second as the two weapons
separately, so there is no downside to
combining weapon systems.
Element.Original:
A combined weapon will always have the
same damage per second as the two weapons
separately, so there is no downside to
combining weapon systems.

Element.Translation: By changing the ratio, you can\ncustomize each weapon system to your\nliking.
Element.Original: By changing the ratio, you can\ncustomize each weapon system to your\nliking.

Element.Translation: Try out the personal guns\nas long as you like, and then\ntalk to NPC-05 for you last lesson
Element.Original: Try out the personal guns\nas long as you like, and then\ntalk to NPC-05 for you last lesson

Element.Translation:
####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####
Try out the weapons as long as you
like and then go over to NPC-05
for your last lesson
Element.Original:
####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####
Try out the weapons as long as you
like and then go over to NPC-05
for your last lesson

Element.Translation:
Congratulations! You are done with the tutorial. End
it any time you want in the main menu (ESC).
There are some more NPCs around that
may tell you one or another secret about this world!
Element.Original:
Congratulations! You are done with the tutorial. End
it any time you want in the main menu (ESC).
There are some more NPCs around that
may tell you one or another secret about this world!

Element.Translation:
####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####
Ok, we are going to mine some minerals,
make a basic factory, and them
craft a power module
Element.Original:
####RADIO-TRANSMISSION####
Ok, we are going to mine some minerals,
make a basic factory, and them
craft a power module

Element.Translation:
There are two kinds of raw resources:
Ores and Shards. There are several
types of each to find in this world.
For basic crafting, the color doesn't matter.
Element.Original:
There are two kinds of raw resources:
Ores and Shards. There are several
types of each to find in this world.
For basic crafting, the color doesn't matter.

Element.Translation:
Ok, there is a big stack
of mineral rich resources
over there.
Let's go mining
Element.Original:
Ok, there is a big stack
of mineral rich resources
over there.
Let's go mining

Element.Translation:
Please mine some Hattel Shards!
Deselect any weapon (mouse wheel)
and hold the right mouse button
on the minerals.
Element.Original:
Please mine some Hattel Shards!
Deselect any weapon (mouse wheel)
and hold the right mouse button
on the minerals.

Element.Translation:
Please mine some Threns ore.
Deselect any weapon (mouse wheel)
and hold the right mouse button
on the minerals!
Element.Original:
Please mine some Threns ore.
Deselect any weapon (mouse wheel)
and hold the right mouse button
on the minerals!

Element.Translation: Great, you have all the resources you need.\nThroughout the universe many different types\nof minerals can be found on planets and asteroids.
Element.Original: Great, you have all the resources you need.\nThroughout the universe many different types\nof minerals can be found on planets and asteroids.

Element.Translation: Specific asteroid types will always contain\nthe same mineral types.
Element.Original: Specific asteroid types will always contain\nthe same mineral types.

Element.Translation: Planets however always have two random\nkinds of minerals per side, but they\nare more sparsely distributed.
Element.Original: Planets however always have two random\nkinds of minerals per side, but they\nare more sparsely distributed.

Element.Translation:
You can process raw materials
yourself, although it's much
more efficient with the factory
blocks. Let's give it a shot!
Element.Original:
You can process raw materials
yourself, although it's much
more efficient with the factory
blocks. Let's give it a shot!

Element.Translation:
Always keep in mind that you only can put in ONE raw
resource at a time in the personal crafter,
because you need a free slot for the product to go.
So it's better to do it in a factory block.
Now let's make some circuits!
Element.Original:
Always keep in mind that you only can put in ONE raw
resource at a time in the personal crafter,
because you need a free slot for the product to go.
So it's better to do it in a factory block.
Now let's make some circuits!

Element.Translation:
Meshes and Circuits are your main ingredients
for all basic crafting recipes. You only need
10 of either Metal Mesh or Crystal Circuits
to make the basic factory.
Element.Original:
Meshes and Circuits are your main ingredients
for all basic crafting recipes. You only need
10 of either Metal Mesh or Crystal Circuits
to make the basic factory.

Element.Translation: Now place either the Metal Meshes,\nor the Crystal Circuits in your\npersonal basic factory craft slot.
Element.Original: Now place either the Metal Meshes,\nor the Crystal Circuits in your\npersonal basic factory craft slot.

Element.Translation:
Awesome! You now have a basic factory!
Remember that factories need power
to produce! This station has enough power though!
Should you ever be in a survival situation,
use a personal power beam to provide power.
Element.Original:
Awesome! You now have a basic factory!
Remember that factories need power
to produce! This station has enough power though!
Should you ever be in a survival situation,
use a personal power beam to provide power.

Element.Translation: Now place the basic factory on the\nmarked position.
Element.Original: Now place the basic factory on the\nmarked position.

Element.Translation: Great!, now press '$ACTIVATE' on the factory\nto open it.
Element.Original: Great!, now press '$ACTIVATE' on the factory\nto open it.

Element.Translation: As you can see, you can put things\ninto the factory or pull them out,\njust like you would do with your hotbar.
Element.Original: As you can see, you can put things\ninto the factory or pull them out,\njust like you would do with your hotbar.

Element.Translation:
Press the 'Change Production' button, and type
in 'power', then hit the drop down
and select 'power reactor module'
to setup the factory
Element.Original:
Press the 'Change Production' button, and type
in 'power', then hit the drop down
and select 'power reactor module'
to setup the factory

Element.Translation:
Awesome! The factory will now produce power
recharge modules.
Oh, and with the 'View Graph' button you can
always check what you need to
produce an item.
Element.Original:
Awesome! The factory will now produce power
recharge modules.
Oh, and with the 'View Graph' button you can
always check what you need to
produce an item.

Element.Translation: Now just throw in your metal mesh in\n(I will give you some if you need any).
Element.Original: Now just throw in your metal mesh in\n(I will give you some if you need any).

Element.Translation: Great! as you can see, it will\nproduce a power module now.
Element.Original: Great! as you can see, it will\nproduce a power module now.

Element.Translation: This concludes the Catalog tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Catalog tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!

Element.Translation:
The catalog keeps track of ship blueprints.
When saving a blueprint in singleplayer they will appear
in your StarMade/blueprints folder.
When you save them on a server they will appear
in the server owner's folder.
Element.Original:
The catalog keeps track of ship blueprints.
When saving a blueprint in singleplayer they will appear
in your StarMade/blueprints folder.
When you save them on a server they will appear
in the server owner's folder.

Element.Translation: You can access the catalog menu\nby pressing '$INVENTORY_PANEL',\nand then clicking on the catalog tab.
Element.Original: You can access the catalog menu\nby pressing '$INVENTORY_PANEL',\nand then clicking on the catalog tab.

Element.Translation:
If you click on 'Create new entry' the game will save
your current entered ship into the catalog.
As admin or during singleplayer you can
also use the command '/save nameofship' in chat
to save ships and even stations (stations will not
be listed but can be loaded with the '/load' command)
Element.Original:
If you click on 'Create new entry' the game will save
your current entered ship into the catalog.
As admin or during singleplayer you can
also use the command '/save nameofship' in chat
to save ships and even stations (stations will not
be listed but can be loaded with the '/load' command)

Element.Translation:
'Save in local catalog' is only relevant
in multiplayer, it will not save the ship
in the server's catalog but in your local
singleplayer catalog.
Element.Original:
'Save in local catalog' is only relevant
in multiplayer, it will not save the ship
in the server's catalog but in your local
singleplayer catalog.

Element.Translation:
You can also upload your local blueprints to the server
so you can buy them on it.
You and the server admins will have access to it,
so be sure you are OK with that.
Element.Original:
You can also upload your local blueprints to the server
so you can buy them on it.
You and the server admins will have access to it,
so be sure you are OK with that.

Element.Translation:
Catalog entries have permissions
that determine who can spawn them: others(everyone)/faction/homebase.
There is a fourth option 'enemy usable' for admins or in singleplayer to
make a ship spawnable for pirates and the trading guild.
Element.Original:
Catalog entries have permissions
that determine who can spawn them: others(everyone)/faction/homebase.
There is a fourth option 'enemy usable' for admins or in singleplayer to
make a ship spawnable for pirates and the trading guild.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;End
Element.Translation: This concludes the Faction Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Faction Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;Start
Element.Translation:
Welcome to the Faction Tutorial.
This tutorial will explain how to manage
your faction and how to keep your ships and homebase
safe from players.
Element.Original:
Welcome to the Faction Tutorial.
This tutorial will explain how to manage
your faction and how to keep your ships and homebase
safe from players.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateA
Element.Translation: Factions are a vital part of StarMade.\nPlayers can gather under 1 faction and work together\nto accomplish a common goal.
Element.Original: Factions are a vital part of StarMade.\nPlayers can gather under 1 faction and work together\nto accomplish a common goal.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateB
Element.Translation:
Press '$FACTION_MENU' to open the faction panel.
From here you can create and edit your own, or join an existing
faction. The 'Faction hub' tab shows you an overview
of all current factions in the game
and allows you to join a public faction.
Element.Original:
Press '$FACTION_MENU' to open the faction panel.
From here you can create and edit your own, or join an existing
faction. The 'Faction hub' tab shows you an overview
of all current factions in the game
and allows you to join a public faction.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateC
Element.Translation:
To create a faction, click on 'Create new faction'
in the 'Personal' tab. Choose a name
and click OK. You can alternatively,
also accept an invite by clicking on 'Invites'.
Element.Original:
To create a faction, click on 'Create new faction'
in the 'Personal' tab. Choose a name
and click OK. You can alternatively,
also accept an invite by clicking on 'Invites'.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateD
Element.Translation:
In the "Faction" tab, you can manage your faction.
You can add a description and
write news posts. News will be visible for all
members of your faction. You can also accept peace
or alliance offers from other factions.
Element.Original:
In the "Faction" tab, you can manage your faction.
You can add a description and
write news posts. News will be visible for all
members of your faction. You can also accept peace
or alliance offers from other factions.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateE
Element.Translation:
Each member of your faction has a rank.
Ranks can be named and their permissions
can be set when clicking the "Roles" button.
To change the name of a rank, click on the name.
Element.Original:
Each member of your faction has a rank.
Ranks can be named and their permissions
can be set when clicking the "Roles" button.
To change the name of a rank, click on the name.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateF
Element.Translation:
Edit: Members are able to edit description
and post news.
Kick: Members can kick players of a lower rank.
Invite: Members are allowed to invite players to the faction.
Permission-Edit: Only give this to faction leaders, as it enables
them to modify the ranks.
Element.Original:
Edit: Members are able to edit description
and post news.
Kick: Members can kick players of a lower rank.
Invite: Members are allowed to invite players to the faction.
Permission-Edit: Only give this to faction leaders, as it enables
them to modify the ranks.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateG
Element.Translation:
You can assign a rank to a player by clicking on 'options'
next to his name.
In that options menu you can see all ranks and
the ability to kick that person from your faction.
Element.Original:
You can assign a rank to a player by clicking on 'options'
next to his name.
In that options menu you can see all ranks and
the ability to kick that person from your faction.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateH
Element.Translation:
You can also choose from several faction options:
'Public faction' makes it possible for players to
join without an invite. 'Declare war on hostile action'
will auto declare war when you faction is attacked.
'Consider neutral enemy' will change the relationship
with all faction-less entities to 'enemy'
Element.Original:
You can also choose from several faction options:
'Public faction' makes it possible for players to
join without an invite. 'Declare war on hostile action'
will auto declare war when you faction is attacked.
'Consider neutral enemy' will change the relationship
with all faction-less entities to 'enemy'

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateI
Element.Translation: In the faction hub, you can declare war\nand send peace/alliance offers by clicking on\nthe 'relation' next to the faction's name.
Element.Original: In the faction hub, you can declare war\nand send peace/alliance offers by clicking on\nthe 'relation' next to the faction's name.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateI1
Element.Translation:
It is possible to assign a ship to your faction.
Only you and your faction members will be able
to use it. To do this, place a "faction module" on the ship,
press $ACITVATE on it and enter the faction signature.
The signature will stay as long as the faction block
is not destroyed.
Element.Original:
It is possible to assign a ship to your faction.
Only you and your faction members will be able
to use it. To do this, place a "faction module" on the ship,
press $ACITVATE on it and enter the faction signature.
The signature will stay as long as the faction block
is not destroyed.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateJ
Element.Translation:
The same goes for a station, with the difference
that you can also make a station a faction's homebase.
Each faction can only have ONE homebase, as it has
a very big advantage: Homebases and everything docked
to it are invulnerable to damage.
Element.Original:
The same goes for a station, with the difference
that you can also make a station a faction's homebase.
Each faction can only have ONE homebase, as it has
a very big advantage: Homebases and everything docked
to it are invulnerable to damage.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateK
Element.Translation: In the future there will be a system that allows\nsome kind of faction war to deal with homebases.
Element.Original: In the future there will be a system that allows\nsome kind of faction war to deal with homebases.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateL
Element.Translation: Factions can, instead of declaring war against a whole faction,\ndeclare war against a single player. This can be done in the\n'Faction' tab and clicking on the 'Personal Enemies' button.
Element.Original: Factions can, instead of declaring war against a whole faction,\ndeclare war against a single player. This can be done in the\n'Faction' tab and clicking on the 'Personal Enemies' button.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the Faction system;StateM
Element.Translation: Faction chat is also available by\nstarting a message with '/f ' in chat,\nor by pressing shift+$CHAT to do that automatically.
Element.Original: Faction chat is also available by\nstarting a message with '/f ' in chat,\nor by pressing shift+$CHAT to do that automatically.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;End
Element.Translation: This concludes the Crafting Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Crafting Tutorial.\nThanks for reading, and thanks for playing\nStarMade!

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;Start
Element.Translation: Welcome to the Crafing Tutorial.\nIt will explain StarMade's\ncrafting and factory system.
Element.Original: Welcome to the Crafing Tutorial.\nIt will explain StarMade's\ncrafting and factory system.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateA
Element.Translation:
Crafting in StarMade is based on a "consistence" system.
Every craftable element has an amount of
other elements it is made from. These other
elements again have other elements they are
made off and so forth.
You can compare this system with a tree that has branches.
Element.Original:
Crafting in StarMade is based on a "consistence" system.
Every craftable element has an amount of
other elements it is made from. These other
elements again have other elements they are
made off and so forth.
You can compare this system with a tree that has branches.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateB
Element.Translation: Consistence trees do not loop, so\nan element (the tree's root) is never in any\nof the branches of its own crafting tree.
Element.Original: Consistence trees do not loop, so\nan element (the tree's root) is never in any\nof the branches of its own crafting tree.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateC
Element.Translation: The other system is using recipes.\nRecipes just determine fixed product lines.\nFor example: 10 of any ore capsule makes a meta mesh.
Element.Original: The other system is using recipes.\nRecipes just determine fixed product lines.\nFor example: 10 of any ore capsule makes a meta mesh.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateD
Element.Translation: Enough theory for now. Here is how you start\nwith absolutely nothing but your initial\npersonal power beam.
Element.Original: Enough theory for now. Here is how you start\nwith absolutely nothing but your initial\npersonal power beam.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateE
Element.Translation:
StarMade's raw resources exist in two groups:
Crystal shards and ores. Each planet part
has two random resources, while the resources
on asteroids are set per type. You'll find
different types of asteroids depending on
the distance between the sector and the star.
Element.Original:
StarMade's raw resources exist in two groups:
Crystal shards and ores. Each planet part
has two random resources, while the resources
on asteroids are set per type. You'll find
different types of asteroids depending on
the distance between the sector and the star.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateF
Element.Translation:
To start, collect some raw ore by salvaging
some resources with a basic ship or as astronaut.
After you've done that, open your inventory with $INVENTORY_PANEL and click the
'Craft Capsule' button. This will open your personal
capsule factory. You can also craft a factory block
that is faster and more efficient.
Element.Original:
To start, collect some raw ore by salvaging
some resources with a basic ship or as astronaut.
After you've done that, open your inventory with $INVENTORY_PANEL and click the
'Craft Capsule' button. This will open your personal
capsule factory. You can also craft a factory block
that is faster and more efficient.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateG
Element.Translation:
Put one type of shards or ores in it and leave
the second slot empty (the processed product will use this slot).
After a short time, you should be
getting a lot of capsules from that type.
Place those in your inventory.
Element.Original:
Put one type of shards or ores in it and leave
the second slot empty (the processed product will use this slot).
After a short time, you should be
getting a lot of capsules from that type.
Place those in your inventory.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateG1
Element.Translation: You can click on the 'Production' button\nto check which raw resource will produce\nwhich capsule.
Element.Original: You can click on the 'Production' button\nto check which raw resource will produce\nwhich capsule.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateH
Element.Translation:
After you made some capsules, click on
the 'Micro' button in your inventory and place
them there. You need 10 capsules of any(!)
type to produce either metal meshes (ore capsules),
or circuits (shard capsules).
Those two are the base ingredients for most of
the blocks in StarMade.
Element.Original:
After you made some capsules, click on
the 'Micro' button in your inventory and place
them there. You need 10 capsules of any(!)
type to produce either metal meshes (ore capsules),
or circuits (shard capsules).
Those two are the base ingredients for most of
the blocks in StarMade.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateI
Element.Translation:
When you have either 20 metal meshes or circuits,
press on the 'craft macro' button to craft your first macro
factory. The macro factory makes every craftable
block in the game. You can only place this block
on a station or a planet.
Element.Original:
When you have either 20 metal meshes or circuits,
press on the 'craft macro' button to craft your first macro
factory. The macro factory makes every craftable
block in the game. You can only place this block
on a station or a planet.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateI1
Element.Translation:
After you placed a macro factory you will see
that it needs power to function. You can provide
that power by shooting it with your personal power
supply beam, or if you have them, placing down
power recharge blocks. If you don't have any power blocks
then it should focus to craft some in your new factory.
Element.Original:
After you placed a macro factory you will see
that it needs power to function. You can provide
that power by shooting it with your personal power
supply beam, or if you have them, placing down
power recharge blocks. If you don't have any power blocks
then it should focus to craft some in your new factory.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateJ
Element.Translation:
Open the macro factory with $ACTIVATE and click on
change production. You can use the filter and type
for example 'power' to quickly find power modules
in the drop down menu. After you chose the power recharge
module, you can click on graph to see exactly
what you need for making that block.
Element.Original:
Open the macro factory with $ACTIVATE and click on
change production. You can use the filter and type
for example 'power' to quickly find power modules
in the drop down menu. After you chose the power recharge
module, you can click on graph to see exactly
what you need for making that block.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateK
Element.Translation:
IMPORTANT: The factory will only do the last step
of the graph. Every step below that will require it's
own factory. In this example the only thing that
this factory will consume is Metal Mesh and
'Active Varat Processore', which you need to produce
in a separate factory (or change the production on this one).
Element.Original:
IMPORTANT: The factory will only do the last step
of the graph. Every step below that will require it's
own factory. In this example the only thing that
this factory will consume is Metal Mesh and
'Active Varat Processore', which you need to produce
in a separate factory (or change the production on this one).

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateL
Element.Translation:
You can of course craft multiple factories
to do all these steps at once.
Furthermore you are able to link factories:
Press $SELECT_MODULE on the factory you want to be able
to take needed materials out for other factories and
press $CONNECT_MODULE on those to connect them with it.
Element.Original:
You can of course craft multiple factories
to do all these steps at once.
Furthermore you are able to link factories:
Press $SELECT_MODULE on the factory you want to be able
to take needed materials out for other factories and
press $CONNECT_MODULE on those to connect them with it.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_This tutorial is about the crafting system;StateM
Element.Translation:
A factory will take ingredients needed from
all the factories that are connected to it.
This basically enables you to rebuild a whole
crafting tree. Then you can put in raw resources
in the bottom and get the high level product on the top.
Element.Original:
A factory will take ingredients needed from
all the factories that are connected to it.
This basically enables you to rebuild a whole
crafting tree. Then you can put in raw resources
in the bottom and get the high level product on the top.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;End
Element.Translation: This concludes the Battle Mode Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!
Element.Original: This concludes the Battle Mode Tutorial.\nThanks for reading,\nand thanks for playing StarMade!

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;Start
Element.Translation: Welcome to the Battle Mode Tutorial
Element.Original: Welcome to the Battle Mode Tutorial

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;StateA
Element.Translation:
Battle Mode is a sub-mode for StarMade
as a simple test for future modes.
It essentially turns the game into a
arcade fighter.
Element.Original:
Battle Mode is a sub-mode for StarMade
as a simple test for future modes.
It essentially turns the game into a
arcade fighter.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;StateB
Element.Translation:
In StarMade, building and
gathering resources takes time,
Battle Mode lets people duel in a
death match or team battle without having
to worry about the rest.
Element.Original:
In StarMade, building and
gathering resources takes time,
Battle Mode lets people duel in a
death match or team battle without having
to worry about the rest.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;StateC
Element.Translation:
Admins can enable Battle Mode by editing
the server.cfg file.
If the "Use_Personal_Sectors" option is set to 'true',
each player will have its own sector he cannot leave,
but he will be provided with an infinite shop that
never runs out of supplies nor requires credits to use,
allowing you to build a PVP ship.
Element.Original:
Admins can enable Battle Mode by editing
the server.cfg file.
If the "Use_Personal_Sectors" option is set to 'true',
each player will have its own sector he cannot leave,
but he will be provided with an infinite shop that
never runs out of supplies nor requires credits to use,
allowing you to build a PVP ship.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;StateD
Element.Translation: To battle, the players have to join a\nspecific faction: Team factions or the FFA faction.
Element.Original: To battle, the players have to join a\nspecific faction: Team factions or the FFA faction.

Element.var: #TUTORIAL_What is and how to use Battle Mode;StateE
Element.Translation:
The game will decide between FFA or Team Deathmatch
by looking at the player count in each faction.
The mode with the most players will be chosen.
Press '$LEADERBOARD' to see the Battle Mode leaderboard.
Element.Original:
The game will decide between FFA or Team Deathmatch
by looking at the player count in each faction.
The mode with the most players will be chosen.
Press '$LEADERBOARD' to see the Battle Mode leaderboard.

Element.Translation:
Do you want to do the tutorial?
It will teleport you to the tutorial sector
Hit next to start the tutorial, or exit to
cancel!
Element.Original:
Do you want to do the tutorial?
It will teleport you to the tutorial sector
Hit next to start the tutorial, or exit to
cancel!

Element.Translation: Teleporting you to the tutorial sector now!
Element.Original: Teleporting you to the tutorial sector now!

Element.Original: Block behavior config upload failed!\nUnsupported Encoding

Element.Original: Scan data received,\ncheck your Navigation Panel!

Element.Original: chunks around spawn position are being loaded: %d seconds to spawn in sector: %s

Element.Original: The system is neutral. Use a faction block to claim it.

Element.Original: The system is owned by your own faction %s!

Element.Original: Activation access denied:\nyou do not have sufficient rank in your faction!

Access denied by faction rank!
You must at least be rank
'%s'
to edit this!

Access denied by faction rank!
You must at least be rank

Access denied by faction rank!
You must at least be rank

to edit this!

Access denied by faction rank!
You must at least be rank

to edit this!

You must at least be rank

Element.Original: State: Cannot edit ship in shipyard at this state:\n%s

Element.Translation: Cannot edit ship in shipyard at this state:\nShipyard invalid!
Element.Original: Cannot edit ship in shipyard at this state:\nShipyard invalid!

Element.Original: You are not allowed\nto modify a shop

Element.Original: Decrypted StarMade credentials ... logging in to star-made.org

Element.Translation: Decrypted StarMade credentials ... logging in to star-made.org
Element.Original: Decrypted StarMade credentials ... logging in to star-made.org

Element.Translation: New block behavior config\nhas been applied.
Element.Original: New block behavior config\nhas been applied.

Element.Translation:
You are running in 32-Bit mode. If your system is 64-Bit,
this can limit the performance and memory given to the game and crash it.

To fix this, please run the beta launcher in STEAM.
To do this, just right click on the game and click on
"Launch with Beta Launcher".

If you don't run the game in STEAM,
please download the 64-Bit launcher from www.star-made.org
Element.Original:
You are running in 32-Bit mode. If your system is 64-Bit,
this can limit the performance and memory given to the game and crash it.

To fix this, please run the beta launcher in STEAM.
To do this, just right click on the game and click on
"Launch with Beta Launcher".

If you don't run the game in STEAM,

Element.Translation:
Warning: Your reactor stabilization is less than 50%. This negatively impacts the performance of your reactor, and causes extra damage to your reactor when it is hit.

Place some stabilizers a distance away from your main reactor to increase your stabilization.
The minimal distance is determined by the size of your main reactor. If you plan on building the stabilizers closer, you will need to place more of them.
Element.Original:
Warning: Your reactor stabilization is less than 50%. This negatively impacts the performance of your reactor, and causes extra damage to your reactor when it is hit.

Place some stabilizers a distance away from your main reactor to increase your stabilization.
The minimal distance is determined by the size of your main reactor. If you plan on building the stabilizers closer, you will need to place more of them.

Element.Translation:
Warning: There is no conduit block next to this chamber block to connect it to your reactor tree.
A chamber needs to be next to a line of conduit blocks to connect it to either the main reactor or to another group of chambers.

You can also add chamber blocks to existing groups of the same general type (e.g. adding stealth chambers to a group of cloak chamber blocks).

Chamber systems are structured like a tree: the tree trunk is the main reactor, and the branches connect the chambers with conduits.
Chamber blocks themselves can be placed next to each other of the same type to increase their size.
Element.Original:
Warning: There is no conduit block next to this chamber block to connect it to your reactor tree.
A chamber needs to be next to a line of conduit blocks to connect it to either the main reactor or to another group of chambers.

You can also add chamber blocks to existing groups of the same general type (e.g. adding stealth chambers to a group of cloak chamber blocks).

Chamber systems are structured like a tree: the tree trunk is the main reactor, and the branches connect the chambers with conduits.
Chamber blocks themselves can be placed next to each other of the same type to increase their size.

Element.Translation:
A conduit connects chambers to a main reactor, or to another chamber in the tree.

Build lines of conduits to create a tree between your chambers and your main reactor.
Then open the radial menu to access your reactor under ship/station -> reactor or press %s when looking at the reactor.
Element.Original:
A conduit connects chambers to a main reactor, or to another chamber in the tree.

Build lines of conduits to create a tree between your chambers and your main reactor.
Then open the radial menu to access your reactor under ship/station -> reactor or press %s when looking at the reactor.

Element.Translation:
You can use different kinds of styles for your display block.
Use a header like <style></style> to select font and color
e.g. <style>c=#FF0000,f=1</style> -> red text with medium font size.
f=x (x can be 0,1,2 for font sizes)
c=x (x has to be a hex code for font (used in css/html) starting with #)


Variables that can be placed inside the text:
%s

If you place an activation block next to this block and connect that block
to another display, the content of that display will be replaced with this one.
There are several other methods to edit the content of the connected display:
* '[PASSWORD]text': The text in this block will not show up.
* '[ADD]text': The text after [ADD] is added to the existing text of the connected block ([ADD] must be in the very front)
* '[DEL]number': Removes an amount of characters from the connected block ([DEL] must be in the very front)
* '[REPLACEFIRST]regexp[WITH]replacement': use java conform regular expressions to replace specific text ([REPLACEFIRST] must be in the very front)
* '[REPLACEALL]regexp[WITH]replacement': use java conform regular expressions to replace specific text ([REPLACEALL] must be in the very front)

You can also use the sensor block to check if two display blocks have equal text content. Just connect the sensor block to two display blocks as input. The [password] tag is ignored when comparing text.
Element.Original:
You can use different kinds of styles for your display block.
Use a header like <style></style> to select font and color
e.g. <style>c=#FF0000,f=1</style> -> red text with medium font size.
f=x (x can be 0,1,2 for font sizes)
c=x (x has to be a hex code for font (used in css/html) starting with #)


Variables that can be placed inside the text:
%s

If you place an activation block next to this block and connect that block
to another display, the content of that display will be replaced with this one.
There are several other methods to edit the content of the connected display:
* '[PASSWORD]text': The text in this block will not show up.
* '[ADD]text': The text after [ADD] is added to the existing text of the connected block ([ADD] must be in the very front)
* '[DEL]number': Removes an amount of characters from the connected block ([DEL] must be in the very front)
* '[REPLACEFIRST]regexp[WITH]replacement': use java conform regular expressions to replace specific text ([REPLACEFIRST] must be in the very front)
* '[REPLACEALL]regexp[WITH]replacement': use java conform regular expressions to replace specific text ([REPLACEALL] must be in the very front)

You can also use the sensor block to check if two display blocks have equal text content. Just connect the sensor block to two display blocks as input. The [password] tag is ignored when comparing text.

and it will set the HP according to your current blocks.

Element.Original:
Do you want to reboot your systems?
This will remove any system failures from low hp
and it will set the HP according to your current blocks.

Element.Original: You cannot change\nroles of higher ranked\nplayers!

Element.Original: Do you really want to promote this member to founder?\nDoing this can only be reverted by a founder\nor if the founder is inactive for over a month.

Element.Original: You can't demote another\nfounder but yourself!

Element.Original: You are currently a faction founder!\nDo you really want to demote yourself?

Element.Translation:
Do you really want to leave this faction?
You'll be unable to access any ship/structure that belongs to this
faction except for your ships that use the Personal Permission Rank.

If you are the last member, the faction will also automatically disband!
Element.Original:
Do you really want to leave this faction?
You'll be unable to access any ship/structure that belongs to this
faction except for your ships that use the Personal Permission Rank.

If you are the last member, the faction will also automatically disband!

Element.Original: Blocks collected for construction will be refunded.

Element.Translation: Cannot split stacks in creative mode.
Element.Original: Cannot split stacks in creative mode.

Element.Translation: Cannot move item from this inventory!
Element.Original: Cannot move item from this inventory!

Element.Translation: Cannot move item from this inventory in test sector!
Element.Original: Cannot move item from this inventory in test sector!

Element.Translation: Exiting a flying ship isn't the best of ideas.
Element.Original: Exiting a flying ship isn't the best of ideas.

Element.Translation: Destroying containers will jettison their contents into space.
Element.Original: Destroying containers will jettison their contents into space.

Element.Translation: Jump Inhibitors are wonderful until you're the prey.
Element.Original: Jump Inhibitors are wonderful until you're the prey.

Element.Translation: Piracy can be a worthwhile source of income.
Element.Original: Piracy can be a worthwhile source of income.

Element.Translation: Asteroid types are distributed based on heat.
Element.Original: Asteroid types are distributed based on heat.

Element.Translation: There are other galaxies to explore!
Element.Original: There are other galaxies to explore!

Element.Translation: You can visit every star in the sky.
Element.Original: You can visit every star in the sky.

Element.Translation: You can customize your ship's thrust output, increasing its speed, rotation, etc.
Element.Original: You can customize your ship's thrust output, increasing its speed, rotation, etc.

Element.Translation: Using Hull blocks in place of Armor allows decoration without the extra weight.
Element.Original: Using Hull blocks in place of Armor allows decoration without the extra weight.

Element.Translation: The Navigation menu allows you to select which markers to display.
Element.Original: The Navigation menu allows you to select which markers to display.

Element.Translation: Winning a race and want to stay that way?\nUse turrets with the Stop effect!
Element.Original: Winning a race and want to stay that way?\nUse turrets with the Stop effect!

Element.Translation: Warp Gates allow instantaneous travel across vast distances.
Element.Original: Warp Gates allow instantaneous travel across vast distances.

Element.Translation: Jump Inhibitors are useful for ambushes.
Element.Original: Jump Inhibitors are useful for ambushes.

Element.Translation: Is something moving too quickly?\nUse a Stop effect weapon to help your aim.
Element.Original: Is something moving too quickly?\nUse a Stop effect weapon to help your aim.

Element.Translation: Fortress shields got you down?\nAdd an Ion effect to your weapons for shield-busting.
Element.Original: Fortress shields got you down?\nAdd an Ion effect to your weapons for shield-busting.

Element.Translation: You are safe within the boundaries of Trading Guild shops\n...provided they like you.
Element.Original: You are safe within the boundaries of Trading Guild shops\n...provided they like you.

Element.Translation: Scavengers may not care about style, but other players might.
Element.Original: Scavengers may not care about style, but other players might.

Element.Translation: Larger ships are more powerful, but much harder to move.
Element.Original: Larger ships are more powerful, but much harder to move.

Element.Translation: Rotated Gravity Modules also influence their gravity direction.
Element.Original: Rotated Gravity Modules also influence their gravity direction.

Element.Translation: Using transporters will temprarily disable your shields.
Element.Original: Using transporters will temprarily disable your shields.

Element.Translation: You may use Gravity Modules to construct gravity lifts!
Element.Original: You may use Gravity Modules to construct gravity lifts!

Element.Translation: A little decoration goes a long way.
Element.Original: A little decoration goes a long way.

Element.Translation: Rail Rotators are useful for decoration, too!
Element.Original: Rail Rotators are useful for decoration, too!

Element.Translation: Rails allow you to move (and rotate) portions of your ship or its interior.
Element.Original: Rails allow you to move (and rotate) portions of your ship or its interior.

Element.Translation: You may customize your controls from the options menu.
Element.Original: You may customize your controls from the options menu.

Element.Translation: Holding [%s] displays the quick radial menu.
Element.Original: Holding [%s] displays the quick radial menu.

Element.Translation: Pressing [%s] while in Build Mode gives you access to Advanced Build Mode.
Element.Original: Pressing [%s] while in Build Mode gives you access to Advanced Build Mode.

Element.Translation: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) allows you to copy/paste.
Element.Original: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) allows you to copy/paste.

Element.Translation: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) symmetry planes reduce your work by up to 8x!
Element.Original: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) symmetry planes reduce your work by up to 8x!

Element.Translation: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) allows you to place multiple blocks at once.
Element.Original: Advanced Build Mode ([%s]) allows you to place multiple blocks at once.

Element.Translation: The Trading Guild is friendly and ferries items between shops. (Player shops, too!)
Element.Original: The Trading Guild is friendly and ferries items between shops. (Player shops, too!)

Element.Translation: In Advanced Build Mode ([%s]), the arrow points to the front of the ship.
Element.Original: In Advanced Build Mode ([%s]), the arrow points to the front of the ship.

Element.Translation: All weapons are balanced; use whichever fits your needs!
Element.Original: All weapons are balanced; use whichever fits your needs!

Element.Translation: Lock-on missiles (beam+missile) only rarely miss their targets.
Element.Original: Lock-on missiles (beam+missile) only rarely miss their targets.

Element.Translation: Use swarm missiles (missile + missile) with caution: they don't discriminate.
Element.Original: Use swarm missiles (missile + missile) with caution: they don't discriminate.

Element.Translation: Combine weapons to get different effects.
Element.Original: Combine weapons to get different effects.

Element.Translation: Beams are quite effective up close, but useless at a distance.
Element.Original: Beams are quite effective up close, but useless at a distance.

Element.Translation: Warheads may detonate if damaged. Use caution!
Element.Original: Warheads may detonate if damaged. Use caution!

Element.Translation: Heavy armor will protect you, but hinders mobility. Choose carefully.
Element.Original: Heavy armor will protect you, but hinders mobility. Choose carefully.

Element.Translation: Missiles may be destroyed with a well-placed shot.
Element.Original: Missiles may be destroyed with a well-placed shot.

Element.Translation: The larger a missile's warhead, the higher its hitpoints.
Element.Original: The larger a missile's warhead, the higher its hitpoints.

Element.Translation: Hostility towards the Trading Guild isn't wise.
Element.Original: Hostility towards the Trading Guild isn't wise.

Element.Translation: Point-defense turrets automatically fire at hostile missiles or astronauts.
Element.Original: Point-defense turrets automatically fire at hostile missiles or astronauts.

Element.Translation: Jammers interfere with hostile AI's targeting abilities.
Element.Original: Jammers interfere with hostile AI's targeting abilities.

Element.Translation: Circuitry in StarMade is Turing-complete: you can make anything!
Element.Original: Circuitry in StarMade is Turing-complete: you can make anything!

Element.Translation: Activators and buttons adjacent to basic rails detect objects moving on that rail.
Element.Original: Activators and buttons adjacent to basic rails detect objects moving on that rail.

Element.Translation: You may specify names for Inner Ship Remotes, which will display on the hotbar.
Element.Original: You may specify names for Inner Ship Remotes, which will display on the hotbar.

Element.Translation: Buttons/Activators copy adjacent rail types and orientations to the rails they are linked to.
Element.Original: Buttons/Activators copy adjacent rail types and orientations to the rails they are linked to.

Element.Translation: You can copy one Display Module to another using buttons/activators
Element.Original: You can copy one Display Module to another using buttons/activators

Element.Translation: Sensors can detect the state of doors, useful for hangar/airlock indicators.
Element.Original: Sensors can detect the state of doors, useful for hangar/airlock indicators.

Element.Translation: Sensors used on thrusters can detect your speed, useful for engine decoration.
Element.Original: Sensors used on thrusters can detect your speed, useful for engine decoration.

Element.Translation: Sensors can compare two Display Modules' contents. Useful for passwords, commands, etc.
Element.Original: Sensors can compare two Display Modules' contents. Useful for passwords, commands, etc.

Element.Translation: It's often worth trying to befriend the neighbors.
Element.Original: It's often worth trying to befriend the neighbors.

Element.Translation: Multiple buttons may toggle a single Flip-Flop (e.g. for light switches)
Element.Original: Multiple buttons may toggle a single Flip-Flop (e.g. for light switches)

Element.Translation: Delays can be chained to achieve longer delays.
Element.Original: Delays can be chained to achieve longer delays.

Element.Translation: A cross-connected Delay and Not-Signal form a basic 0.5 second clock.
Element.Original: A cross-connected Delay and Not-Signal form a basic 0.5 second clock.

Element.Translation: You can use Rail Speed Controllers to set rotation speeds.
Element.Original: You can use Rail Speed Controllers to set rotation speeds.

Element.Translation: As of June 1st, 2017, the StarMade Launcher consists of 10,688 lines of code.
Element.Original: As of June 1st, 2017, the StarMade Launcher consists of 10,688 lines of code.

Element.Original: If you find a bug, report it on phab.starma.de!

Element.Translation:
Screen settings changed. Keep?
(Will automatically revert back in %s seconds)
NOTICE FOR 4k MONITOR OWNERS ON WINDOWS10: There is a scaling issue in fullscreen due
to Windows DPI scaling. Until a thirdparty library update can resolve this automatically,
there is a workaround:
1. For steam: Right click on StarMade -> properties -> local files Tab -> Browse local files button2. navigate to the dep\java\jre1.7.0_80\bin folder
3. here, right click on "javaw.exe" (must have the w on the end), and go to properties.
4. Go to the "compatibility" tab and check the "override high DPI scaling behavior." checkbox and Select "System" in the dropdown.
Element.Original:
Screen settings changed. Keep?
(Will automatically revert back in %s seconds)
NOTICE FOR 4k MONITOR OWNERS ON WINDOWS10: There is a scaling issue in fullscreen due
to Windows DPI scaling. Until a thirdparty library update can resolve this automatically,
there is a workaround:
1. For steam: Right click on StarMade -> properties -> local files Tab -> Browse local files button2. navigate to the dep\java\jre1.7.0_80\bin folder
3. here, right click on "javaw.exe" (must have the w on the end), and go to properties.
4. Go to the "compatibility" tab and check the "override high DPI scaling behavior." checkbox and Select "System" in the dropdown.

Element.Translation:
You can use this system to upgrade your weapons or to use defensively on your ship.

To link your Controller to its Modules, press %s on the Controller, then %s on the individual modules, 
or alternatively Shift + $CONNECT_MODULE to mass select grouped modules.

Afterwards you can link it to a weapon by connecting the weapon controller you want to upgrade
with the effect controller you just made.
You can do this manually with $SELECT_MODULE and $CONNECT_MODULE or in the Weapons Menu.


Effect:
%s

Note that for the full effect, 
you need to connect 1:1 in size. 
The amount of linked modules of your effect has to be the same amount of your weapon.

If not used linked to a weapon, 
the system has a defensive effect you can enable
Place the computer on your hotbar in the Weapons Menu
and activate it:
Element.Original:
You can use this system to upgrade your weapons or to use defensively on your ship.

To link your Controller to its Modules, press %s on the Controller, then %s on the individual modules, 
or alternatively Shift + $CONNECT_MODULE to mass select grouped modules.

Afterwards you can link it to a weapon by connecting the weapon controller you want to upgrade
with the effect controller you just made.
You can do this manually with $SELECT_MODULE and $CONNECT_MODULE or in the Weapons Menu.


Effect:
%s

Note that for the full effect, 
you need to connect 1:1 in size. 
The amount of linked modules of your effect has to be the same amount of your weapon.

If not used linked to a weapon, 
the system has a defensive effect you can enable
Place the computer on your hotbar in the Weapons Menu
and activate it:

Element.Translation:
This controller can be connected to other weapons
and systems (cannon, beam, damage pulse, missile)
to customize your weapon.

To link your Controller to its Modules, press %s on the Controller, then %s on the individual modules, 
or alternatively Shift + $CONNECT_MODULE to mass select grouped modules.

Afterwards you can link it to another weapon by connecting the weapon controller you want to upgrade
with the weapon controller you just made.
You can do this manually with $SELECT_MODULE and $CONNECT_MODULE or in the Weapons Menu.

Note that for the full effect, 
you need to connect 1:1 in size.
Element.Original:
This controller can be connected to other weapons
and systems (cannon, beam, damage pulse, missile)
to customize your weapon.

To link your Controller to its Modules, press %s on the Controller, then %s on the individual modules, 
or alternatively Shift + $CONNECT_MODULE to mass select grouped modules.

Afterwards you can link it to another weapon by connecting the weapon controller you want to upgrade
with the weapon controller you just made.
You can do this manually with $SELECT_MODULE and $CONNECT_MODULE or in the Weapons Menu.

Note that for the full effect, 
you need to connect 1:1 in size.
